loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 35-years-old from Olkalou. He is married to Miriam and they are blessed with three children aged 13, nine and five years old.

He is a farmer, a business he has been running for the last 13 years.  To enable him to buy some fertilizers and pesticides to spray his vegetables for maximum yields, he has applied for his fifth loan of KES 40,000 from VisionFund Kenya.  His monthly income right now is KES 20,000 and his plan is to use the profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children.

In the future, Wilson hopes to be a successful farmer in his region.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetables

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es: En neumáticos para motocicletas y carros, invirtió Santiago su credikiva anterior, con ello logró tener más inventarios de repuestos y prestar un mejor servicio a su clientela. Sus ventas aumentaron y mejoró su calidad de vida, por eso satisfecho, planea hacer un nuevo financiamiento, para responder con nuevos inventarios de repuestos y llantería en general, destinados a mejorar los vehículos de sus clientes etc.  Por lo cual acude a un credikiva,  a fin de lograr nuevamente hacerlo exitoso.
texts.en: Santiago invested his prior Kiva loan in motorcycle and car tires.  With this, he managed to have a wider stock of spare parts available and offer better service to his clientele.  His sales increased and he improved his quality of life.  Pleased with this, he is planning to take out a new loan, to restock parts and tires in general, intended to improve his customers’ vehicles.  Because of this he is turning to a Kiva loan, with the goal of being successful once again.

loans.use: to buy auto parts and tires.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is a married woman. She describes herself as being God-fearing. 

Mercyline operates a tailoring shop where she makes new clothes to sell. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be a shortage of water. 

Mercyline will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit five family members. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables to sell. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be inadequate water supply. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water pump and pipes for pumping water to her farm.This will enable her to have a constant supply of water in her farm. This will benefit 10 family members. 

She hopes that in the future, she will extend her farming area. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water pump and pipes

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman. She describes herself to be creative. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sale. Her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her family challenge to be a shortage of water. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank for storing clean water for domestic use. This will benefit seven family members. 

She hopes that in the future, she will access water easily. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 45 year old married woman with 3 children between the ages of 16 and 20. She describes herself as determined. She has operated a grocery store for 10 years to local residents. 

Her biggest business challenge is lack of funds to increase her stock of vegetables. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase vegetables. 

Margaret hopes that in the future, she will continue her employment. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of 20,000 KES  was  successfully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to increase her stock.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernan tiene una meta y es la de hacer mas productivo su negocio de venta de alimentos, actividad que nació desde al año 2008, producto de la experiencia de su madre, a quien ha visto haciendo almuerzos, desde que él era muy niño. Hoy ya adulto, Hernan inicia su día laboral desde las 7 de la mañana y termina a las 3 de la tarde, porque su producto exclusivo son los almuerzos, y los ofrece a sus clientes, todos los días sin cesar, desde lunes a sábados. El compra de contado y   a mayoristas  y vende a empleados de empresa, su sueño es tener contratos para aumentar sus ingresos. En la actualidad se ha acercada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará insumos, como aceite, arroz, cárnicos etc, en un mayor volumen, con el fin de hacer  efectivo sus compras y no depender de la recuperación del dinero, producto de sus ventas, para poder servir mejor a su clientela.  Y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión se proyecte muy exitosa.
texts.en: Hernan's goal is to make the food business he started in 2008 more productive. The business is the product of his mother's experience, because he has watched her prepare lunches since he was a very young boy. Now as an adult, Hernan starts the work day at 7 AM and finishes at 3 PM. Lunches are his only product and he sells to his customers every day Monday through Saturday without exception. He buys from wholesalers in installments and sells to the employees of businesses, and his dream is to increase his income through contracts. Currently he has contacted the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to apply for a credikiva, which is the first loan he has applied for at this organization, and with it he will purchase larger quantities of ingredients like oil, rice, meat, etc. The objective is to pay for his purchases outright and not have to wait to recoup money from sales, so as to provide a better service to his customers. That's exactly why he sees a very successful outcome for his investment.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like oil, rice, meat, etc

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 29-year-old, hardworking married man who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a bar, a business he started in order to raise money to support his family. Being a good father, he desires to educate his children at the college degree level. Price fluctuations and the high cost of rent pose a challenge to his business. His desire is to own a modern bar that attracts executive customers. Moses is requesting for a loan to buy drinks such as sodas and beer ahead of the Christmas season, which is characterized by increased sales.

loans.use: to buy drinks such as sodas and beer ahead of the Christmas season, which is characterized by increased sales.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two school-aged children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a clothing shop, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Saumu is requesting for a loan to purchase bales of clothing for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing for resale

loans.name: Dorfine

texts.en:
Dorfine operates a retail shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby in addition she sells sporting goods to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. The previous loan helped her to boost her business and she appreciates the support. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, Dorfine wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, milk, cooking fat, and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, milk, cooking fat, and charcoal.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a rural housewife of 24 years, and she has completed primary education. She lives with her two sons and one daughter and her husband, Nirmal. They live in the small village of West Magurmari in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw-made). They are providing education to their two children who are students of grade 2 and grade 7. The third one is below the school-going age.

Sumitra's husband is a farmer by profession. He attended school up to grade 5. He grows green vegetables like beans, chilies, bitter gourd, etc. on his ancestral land and sells them in the local market. It is the main source of income for the family.  Sumitra also helps her husband in his agricultural work, after managing her household work. However, the income from their agribusiness is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family.

To continue running the agribusiness in a sustainable way and grow other vegetables, they need to make some investments. Sumitra has taken a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation of potatoes on their land, besides other vegetables. They hope to earn additional profit, as the product has a good potential in the present market.

Sumitra plans to utilize the profit to give a better financial condition to her family, educate her children so that they can go ahead in life, and in the future, upgrade their house in to a pacca (concrete-made) one.

She and her husband are thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Los Agricultores De Crucete Group

texts.es:
Osmar, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo y reside en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Tiene aproximadamente 25 años de dedicarse a la producción de maíz, esta producción la vende en el mercado local y obtiene sus propios ingresos. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo en forma grupal que en lo personal solicita 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y poder sacar mejor cosecha. Su propósito es seguir trabajando para darle lo mejor a su familia. 
El grupo se llama Los Agricultores de Crucete, que esta integrado por cinco miembros que también se dedican al cultivo de maíz y viven en la misma comunidad. Cada uno solicita un préstamo de 10,000 Lempiras, haciendo un total de 50,000, con el cual van a comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos. En la foto se identifican de la siguiente manera: a la izquierda es Manuel, José Elio de camisa azul, José Osmar de camisa amarilla, Melvin de camisa manga larga a la derecha y atrás esta Osmar.
texts.en:
Osmar, 37, lives with his common-law wife, with whom he has a child.  They live in the municipality of Olanchito.  For 25 years, he has been cultivating corn.  He sells his crops in the local market to obtain his income.  He is requesting a second loan within his communal bank, from which he will take a sum of 10,000 Honduran lempiras to buy fertilizers to cultivate corn.  This way, he can get a better harvest.  His goal is to continue to work to provide the best for his family.

Osmar's communal bank is names "Los Agricultores de Crucete."  This group has 4 other members who also cultivate corn and live in the same community. Each of them is requesting a sum of 10,000 Honduran lempiras, so the total group loan is for 50,000 lempiras.  Each member will use the loan to buy fertilizers to improve their crops.  

In the photo, they are identified as follows: on the left is Manuel, Jose Elio is wearing a blue shirt, Jose Osmar is wearing a yellow shirt, Melvin is in the long-sleeved shirt on the right, and standing behind the others is Osmar.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his corn crops

loans.name: Pius' Group

texts.en:
Pius is a member of Lukwa Group in Webuye District.  He is in a group of three One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent 21 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Pius has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.	

Pius is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  He is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Pius has been a farmer for 20 years.  He described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  	

Pius joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Pius joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, receive fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family and his send children to school.  Because he likes being a leader and an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Pius has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved his life because he has earned more profits from his harvest, has more farm training and farm group support, and is able to save money and  feed the family.  In the future, Pius hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, and buy a cow. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Pius and the Lukwa Group will use the loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continue providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and this loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Carlos Ignacio

texts.es:
Carlos Ignacio es cliente Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Carlos tiene 30 años y es soltero, él se dedica al servicio de transporte en mototaxi desde hace 12 años. 

Él es dueño de 5 mototaxi que operan en una unidad habitacional, da a trabajar cuatro de esas unidades y él opera la otra. Inició con bicicletas y poco a poco logró adquirir motos. Este préstamo lo pide para comprar más motos, darlas a trabajar y así tener mayores ingresos. 

Con el esfuerzo de su negocio Carlos quiere obtener beneficios en su vida personal, mejorar algunas bicicletas que le quedan a motocicletas y su reto es adquirir un taxi.
texts.en:
Carlos Ignacio is a customer of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Carlos is 30 years old and single. For 12 years he has worked in run a mototaxi business.

He is the owner of five mototaxis which operate in a housing complex, giving work to four of its residents as well as himself. He began with bicycles and little by little was able to buy motorbikes. He is asking for a loan to buy more motorbikes to provide more work for the community and earn a greater income.

Through his hard work in his business, Carlos hopes to improve his personal life and to trade some of the bicycles he still has for motorbikes. His goal is to buy a taxi.

loans.use: to buy motorbikes for his business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es: Teresita, tiene la edad  de 26 años, está soltera,  vive con su hijo, padres y hermanos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una máquina de coser, la cual le facilite la elaboración de ropa y así poder aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones por medio del INA y poder tener ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de telas y otras productos, y también lograr un mejor acabado a las prendas fabricadas, además de aumentar la cantidad de unidades confeccionadas. Con esta compra pretende hacer más ropa y así cumplir con los pedidos a corto plazo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Teresita is 26 years old, single, and lives with her son, parents, and siblings who are her main priority.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a sewing machine, which she will use to make clothing and be able to take advantage of the training through INA.  She will also be able to buy fabrics and other supplies so she can better finish her clothing and increase her production.  With this she will be able to make more clothing and fulfill more orders in the short term.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Rebeca tiene 25 años, es divorciada y tiene una hija. Ella inició su negocio hace un año ya que le gusta bastante la repostería, lo que la motiva a dedicarse a la venta de postres. 

Ella vende fresas con crema, duraznos con crema, gelatinas de agua y leche, flan napolitano y pastel. Ya que inició su negocio hace poco pide este préstamo para comprar utensilio de cocina para darle mejor presentación a sus postres y así incrementar sus ventas. 

Con el trabajo en su negocio Rebeca quiere sacar adelante a su hija.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a Kubo Financiero client, and this is her story:

Rebeca, 25, is divorced and has a daughter. A year ago, she started selling desserts because she liked making them. She sells strawberries with cream, peaches with cream, jellos made with water and milk, Napoleon flan, and pastries. Since she recently started the business, she is applying for this loan to buy kitchen utensils to make her desserts look more appealing and increase sales. Rebeca wants to support her daughter through her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils to make her desserts look more appealing.

loans.name: Ana Mariana

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana forma parte desde hace 10 años del grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías, vive por un sector perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, este sector es muy turístico ya que es el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio. Le gusta estar en su grupo ya que todas tienen una muy buena amistad, comparten gratos momentos y se ayudan mutuamente.
La Señora Ana tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijas solteras trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su esposo es jubilado y labora en la agricultura, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Ana se dedica a las tareas de la casa, cría cuyes y gallinas, cultiva y las cosechas son para consumo de su hogar y para la venta, también se dedica a la costura de todo tipo de prenda de vestir.
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela y en alimento para sus animales. Su sueño es continuar creciendo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Ana has been part of the credit group sector, 3 Marías, for 10 years. She lives in a sector that belongs to the the parish of Turi in Cuenca. This is an area with a lot of tourists, as it looks out over the city. The people there work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade. She likes being in her group because they all have a good friendship, they share pleasant moments, and they help each other.

Señora Ana is 63 years old, married, and her through her marriage she has had 6 children. Four of them are married and live independently, and her two daughters, who are single, work and help her financially.  Her husband is retired and works in agriculture, and they own their home.

Doña Ana does housework, raises guinea pigs and chickens, and grows produce to eat at home and to sell. She also sews, making any type of garment. 

She is going to use her loan to purchase fabric and animal feed. Her dream is to continue growing in her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and animal feed.

loans.name: Mbène

texts.fr: Madame Mbène, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont trois garçons qui sont majeurs et qui travaillent et appui dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Mbène fait du commerce depuis 5 ans période à laquelle elle a commencé à solliciter des crédits à IMCEC. Son commerce consiste à acheter du mil, de l’arachide, de l’oseille, de le garder jusqu'à la période de pénurie pour pouvoir le revendre à des prix plus élevé. Avec son financement elle compte acheter ces meme produits qu'elle commercialise  et va les revendre sur le marché. Elle n’a pas de charges car elle a ses enfants qui s’occupent de la dépense quotidienne et des petits besoins de la famille. Mbène aimerait dans l’avenir diversifier, ses activités et utiliser sa boutique pour faire autre chose que du stockage.
texts.en:
Madame Mbène is married and the mother of five children. Three of her children are boys who are of age. They work and help out with the management of the day-to-day expenses.

Mbène started her business five years ago. At that time, she began requesting loans from IMCEC. Her business consists of buying millet, peanuts, and sorrel until there's a shortage. She then sells her goods a higher price. With the funding she plans to buy these products to sell on the market.

She does not have expenses as her children take care of the day-to-day expenses and the small needs of the family. 

In the future, Mbène would like to diversify her business and use her boutique for other uses besides stocking inventory.

loans.use: buy millet cereal, peanuts, and sorrel for resale

loans.name: Señor De Los Temblores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes Malena ella es conviviente y tiene 36 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos como refrigeradoras, lavadoras, ollas y cocinas, la socia trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de elecdromesticos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cocinas, refrigeradoras y ollas.

El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de imprenta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de electrodomésticos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Señor de los Temblores Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

The member, Lourdes Malena, 35, lives with her companion and has two children.  She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. in her business selling appliances such as refrigerators, washing machines, ovens, and stoves.  She has been in this business for eight years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her appliance business.

Lourdes Malena is requesting the loan to buy stoves, refrigerators, and ovens.
 
The member that is added to the photo took the photo later on. He obtained permission to do this because he had work obligations.

The other members earn a living in fruit sales, a printing business, a grocery store, and appliance sales.

Lourdes Malena is grateful to those who share her dream through this loan and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy stoves, refrigerators, and ovens

loans.name: Rosa Maclovia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa desde hace tres años realiza créditos a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Sector 3 Marías, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque le permite salir de la rutina de su trabajo y compartir gratos momentos con sus amigas. Vive por un sector perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, este sector es muy turístico ya que es el mirador de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.
La Señora. Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 18, 17 y 15 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y estudian, su tercera hija es casada y vive independiente, su último hijo estudia en el colegio, su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia. 
Doña Rosa se dedica a las tareas de su hogar, cría pollos, cerdos y cuyes, también cultiva y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y también lo vende.
Esta repitiendo su crédito que es para comprar alimento sus pollos ya que tiene un criadero grande. Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa has for the past three years taken out loans with her friends and colleagues from the Sector 3 Marías Communal Bank. She is pleased with this type of loan because it allows her step away from her work routine and spend a little time with her friends.

Doña Rosa is 41 and married to a bricklayer who works in the construction industry. The couple owns their own home and are the parents of four children, ages 21, 18, 17, and 15. The two oldest children are sons who work and study; the third child is a daughter who is married and lives with her husband; and the youngest son is in high school. 

Doña Rosa and her family live in a section of Turi Parish in Cuenca, Ecuador, where many people are farmers, ranchers, and shopkeepers. Doña Rosa's  neighborhood is very popular with tourists as it offers beautiful views of the city.  

Doña Rosa takes care of her home and also raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She also grows crops for the family and sells part of the harvest. 

Doña Rosa is taking out another loan to purchase feed for her chickens as she has a large flock. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for chickens.

loans.name: Nora Doris

texts.es:
Doris vive en el distrito de San Juan de Lurigancho, con mucho esfuerzo logro tener su negocio de venta de gas domésticos, y con cuyos ingresos puede sacar adelante a su pequeños hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad.

Doris esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a la mototaxi con la cual reparte los balones de gas, de esta manera podrá tener un vehículo en buenas condiciones para atender los pedidos de sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una casa propia”.
texts.en:
Doris lives in the San Juan de Lurigancho district.  She puts a lot of effort into her business selling gas for home use.  She's able to get her young 5 and 7 year-old children ahead with her income.

Doris is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to perform general maintenance on her motorcycle taxi, with which she distributes the gas cylinders.

This way her vehicle will be in good condition for tending to customer requests and being able to improve her income.  She'll continue striving to achieve her big dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Jacqueline Rocio

texts.es: La señora Jacqueline de 31 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija que depende de sus ingresos, se dedica a prestar servicios como gerente comercial en una empresa donde ha mostrado ser una persona responsable y con muchas ganas de superarse para llegar a un mejor puesto de trabajo, su pareja la abandono hace 6 años, desde ese momento lucho y paso muchos obstáculos en el transcurso de su vida, recientemente le robaron monitores de su café internet, por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de monitores, el mismo es administrado por su madre, pero ahora se encuentra cerrado, este es un ingreso económico extra que obtiene para satisfacer las necesidades económicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 31, is single and has a daughter who depends on her income.  She makes a living as the business manager in a company.  She has shown herself to be a responsible person with a great desire for self-improvement so she can get a better job.

Her spouse abandoned her six years ago.  Since then she has struggled and faced many obstacles in her life.

Recently the monitors were stolen from Jacqueline's Internet café, so she's requesting a loan to buy monitors.  Her mother runs the café but currently it's closed.  This is an extra income she earns to satisfy her family's economic needs.

loans.use: to buy monitors

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a 61-year-old married man with 6 children between the ages of 15 and 30. He describes himself as confident. 

He has operated a farm to grow tea for 2 years. His business is well located and he has both large and small scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as tea price fluctuations. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more tea leaves for resale. 

His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes to be prosperous in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to resell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Yolanda con su negocio, de fabricación de ropa infantil y venta calzado para damas, Con su anterior credikiva se benefició mucho, porque logró tener en sus manos un mayor capital para invertir, su liquidez fluyó, por eso se incrementaron sus ventas y sus utilidades y con ello los ingresos de la microempresa y de su familia. "Dios los bendiga para que sigan apoyándonos siempre" son sus palabras para con los finaciadores de Kiva. 
En la actualidad requiere atender los pedidos de su clientela,porque son superiores en el mes de Diciembre  y su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder a esta oportunidad, por ello está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamineto, mediante el cual comprará, tela para elaborar ropa para niñas, vestidos para damas , comprará calzado y accesorios tambien . Asi estará satisfecha su clientela mientras ella aumenta sus ganancias, para lograr mayor bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Yolanda with her business making children's clothing and selling women's shoes. She was greatly benefited by her last Kiva loan, because she was able to have more capital at hand to invest. Her liquidity fluctuated, so her sales and profits increased along with the earnings of her small business and her family's income. "God bless them so they will always keep supporting us" are her words for the Kiva lenders. 

She currently needs to attend to her customers' requests, because they are higher during the month of December and her working capital is insufficient for responding to them at this time. She is therefore applying for a new loan, with which she will buy fabric to make children's clothing and women's dresses, shoes and accessories. Her customer base will thus be satisfied while she increases her earnings in order to achieve greater well being for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing for little girls, women's dresses, shoes and accessories

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 41-year-old married man with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 12. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a taxi business to transport customers. He also grows tea to sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is well located to support his customers. He will use the 50,000 KES  to buy  tea leaves, fuel for his taxi,  and start another business. 

His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes to be prosperous in the future. This is Anthony's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, fuel for his taxi, and start another business.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
María, a sus 42 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente desde hace 10 años aproximadamente; vende comidas que ella misma elabora como tamales y morcilla, además presta el servicio de alimentación para fiestas y banquetes durante los fines de semana, vende ropa, productos por catálogo y artículos de decoración para el hogar, especialmente navideños. Estos oficios los aprendió de manera empírica y ahora se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos para solventar las necesidades básicas de su familia.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos y mercancía al por mayor, con el ánimo de aprovechar la temporada de fin de año y cumplir con las solicitudes de los contactos de las casas de banquetes, esto le permitirá mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su ardua labor.
María manifiesta que su mayor propósito es poder adquirir un local fijo, en el que pueda prestar sus servicios y generar oportunidades de empleo, esto le ayudará para mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old. She’s worked as an independent retailer for about 10 years. She sells food that she makes like tortillas and black pudding. She also caters for parties and banquets on weekends and sells clothing, catalogue items, and home décor, including Christmas decorations. She learned this work on the job, and right now it’s her main way of bringing in income to meet her family’s basic needs. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies and merchandise in bulk with the intention to take advantage of the holiday season and to fill the orders she has with banquet facilities. This will allow her to increase the income she gets from her hard work.  

María says that her big goal is to be able to have a fixed location where she can provide her services and generate employment opportunities. This will improve her business’s profitability and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more assorted drinks, biscuits and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been in business making artificial jewelry for many years. She beautifully makes earrings and necklaces and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  

In order to meet the orders on time and boost her sales, Shazia has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase raw material, such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. 

She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Susan Camila

texts.es: Ella se llama susan camila, esta estudiando administración hotelera, la cual le gusta esta carrera por la competencia laboral que en estos momentos ay en el país por los campos que la componen y las actividades al desarrollarse ya en el hotel, le interesa mucho esta carrera porque ella como estudiante la parte administrativa o de alimentos y bebidas le agrada, son esas dos categorías la cual desarrolla con facilidad y agrado, por eso mismo le agradece el convenio que esta adquiriendo  con ustedes, pues eso le ayuda a seguir estudiando lo que le gusta, y a si mismo encuentra un sustento económico para la realización de ese proyecto de vida, a si lograr nuevas escalas de conocimiento con la ayuda adquirida, puesto que el convenio la favorece grandemente para poner en practica los conocimientos que adquirió en la institución campo alto
texts.en:
This is Susan Camila, who is studying  hotel management. She likes this field because currently there are good employment opportunities in the occupations that comprise the country's growing hotel industry, especially food and beverage management, which she likes, and does very well.

For this reason she is grateful for the loan that she is receiving from Kiva, which is helping her to fulfill this goal in her life: to continue to study what she likes, achieve higher levels of learning, and put the knowledge that she has gained at Campo Alto into practice.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Saksida Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADELEINE représente le groupe SAKSIDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 19ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 01personne en charge.
Mme vend du poisson à la braise depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville. Ses clients sont  les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02cartons de poissons frais.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider à la scolarisation de son enfant. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand poissonerie.
texts.en: Ms. MADELEINE represents the group SAKSIDA. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 30 years old, and the youngest is 19. One of them is in school. She has one person to support. Ms. MADELEINE has been selling grilled fish for five years. She gets her supplies at the big market in town. Her customers are men and women. She wants to purchase 2 boxes of fresh fish. With her profits, she wants to help with her children's education. Her ambition is to open a large fish shop.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for her restaurant

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
La joven diana carolina de santa marta magdalena, estudiante de mercadeo y ventas de la institución campo alto cuenta como le ha ido en su proceso estudiantil.
Ella cuenta como su carrera la ha ayudado en su ambiente personal  y profesional.
En lo personal le ha a ayudado en saberse expresar, ser abierta a cualquier pensamiento o idea, en lo profesional le ha ayudado a ser muy creativa, ser ágil en los pensamientos, a tener fluidez verbal, saber ser una líder con sólidos conocimientos acerca del mercadeo actual. También ser altamente competitiva no pasando por encima de la ética y los valores.
También nos cuenta como le ha ido en su proceso de practicas, cuenta que esta muy agradecida con la institución al haberla puesto en una muy buena institución donde ha desarrollado sus funciones acerca de el mercadeo como lo son el tele mercadeo e información al cliente.
Le gustaría que kiva le ayudara por una sencilla razón la cual es poder culminar su estudio técnico y a si poder comenzar a laborar y empezar a tener experiencia laboral certificada.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina, from Santa Marta in Magdalena, is a young sales and marketing student at the CampoAlto institution. She talks about how being a student has gone for her.

She talks about how her course of study has helped her in her personal and professional life.

Personally, it has helped her to know how to express herself, to be open to any thought or idea. Professionally, it has helped her to be very creative, to be an agile thinker, to have verbal fluency, to know how to be a leader with solid knowledge of the current market, and also to be highly competitive without ignoring ethics and values.

She also tells us how her internship has gone for her. She says that she is very grateful to the institution for having placed her in a very good institution where she has performed marketing duties such as telemarketing and customer service.

She would like Kiva to help her for a simple reason, which is to be able to finish her technical program and thus to be able to start to work and begin to have certified work experience.

loans.use: to pay fees for a semester

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 27-year-old man who lives in Hodeidah,Yemen. He  operates a shop to sell games, perfume and gifts. He has a few years of experience  and has gained the necessary skills and experience to be a successful entrepreneur. He has learned both market prices and his customers' needs very well. Hence, he usually buys merchandise for lower prices than his competitors and resells it more profitably. He would like to expand his business and buy games, gifts, perfume and clocks; for this purpose he has applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

In the future, Yasser wishes to increase his sales to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy games, gifts, perfume and clocks to expand his business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old and widowed with two children. Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for four years and also earns additional income from frozen foods. 

She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store. Gloria has previously borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF, prior to this loan. Gloria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Helen has been in this business for 6 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Helen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 52-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

She belongs to a poor family, her family passing their lives by hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gent’s clothes. He has been running this business for many years. It is his misfortune that he could not create a good relationship among his customers, and this is the reason he could not establish his enterprise.

Now, with an increase in their basic needs, they consider it necessary that the business should grow also. But the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband.  Therefore, Zubaida took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan, her husband will purchase more clothes to sell. Zubaida thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Hendreta

texts.en:
Hendreta is 53 years old and has a live-in partner with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hendreta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, sugar, diapers, shampoo, bread, soft drinks, etc. 

Hendreta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Bernardina

texts.es:
María Bernardina es una mujer de 33 años de edad, la cual es ama de casa y agricultora con una profesión secundaria graduada como perito mercantil y contador público gracias al apoyo financiero y moral de sus padres. En su hogar solo hay un hijo el cual para ella y su conyugue es una bendición el cual este pequeño. Junto a su pareja se dedica a la agricultura ya que por la falta de empleo en su comunidad no es posible que ella ejerza su carrera a pesar de que le hubiese gustado. Desde muy temprana edad ella se dedica a la agricultura siendo sus padres quienes la motivaran y le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra ya que en su familia es una vocación. Sus clientes son los vecinos, familiares y amigos como también los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto con calidad e higiene. El terreno que en compañía de su compañero de hogar trabaja es propio gracias a una herencia de sus padres ubicado muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando diariamente.
Sus metas como agricultora seguir ampliando sus cultivos de hortalizas, plantar nuevo producto ya que la tierra es apta y fértil para cultivar. Como madre apoyar a su hijo en todo lo necesario para que él pueda estudiar y cumplir sus metas y sueños. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de semilla de papa certificada de primera y comprar insumos agrícolas con los que asistirá y dará un mejor cuido para la cosecha.
texts.en:
María Bernardina, 33, is a homemaker and farmer. Thanks to her parents' financial and moral support, she also is a certified public accountant. She and her husband have just one son, who is a blessing. She and her husband farm because there isn't local work for her to practice her accounting career, much as she would like to. 

She began to farm as a child, and her parents encouraged and taught her how to work the land, as this is a family trade. Her customers are neighbors, relatives, friends, and some distributors who come to the area to buy quality, safe merchandise. She and her husband own the land they work, which she inherited from her parents. It is close to their house, and they walk to it each day.

As a farmer, she wants to expand her vegetable crops and plant new ones, as the land is appropriate and fertile. As a mother, she wants to give her son all he needs to study and accomplish his goals and dreams. She has applied for a loan to buy farming supplies and certified potato seed to take better care of her crops.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and certified potato seed to plant and fertilize.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 28 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Él se gana la vida trabajando como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda para lo cual comprará lámina, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, age 28, lives in his own house, together with his wife and three dependent children.  He earns his living as an employee in a company near his neighborhood.  In this way, he earns his living and takes care of his home.  

With the goal of improving his living conditions, he is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairs on the roof of his home.  He will buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es: Ada de 33 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus tres hijas de 12 años, 9 años y 5 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. Ada se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar quien junto a su esposo buscan la forma de dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Desea construir un cuarto  para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y así poder mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: 33-year-old Ada lives in her own house with her husband and their three daughters, ages 12, 9, and 5, who are currently students. Ada has had a store for a long time. It is how she makes a living and supports her home; together with her husband, she is looking for a way to improve the living conditions for her family. She wishes to build a bedroom, for which she is requesting this FUSAI loan in order to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, and ion. She hopes to be able to obtain said funding so that she may be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron to build a bedroom in her home.

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr: Le Groupement DEGGO  est composé de 20 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. Ils sont à leur 1er prêt et souhaite élargir leur activité dans toute la commune. Leur présidente Fatou  est une femme très brave qui évolue dans l’achat et la vente de produits alimentaires et cosmétiques. elle demande ce montant pour renforcer son fond de commerce et acheter des produits alimentaires comme le riz, le sucre et le lait Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Sa principale charge est la famille, elle aide souvent son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarités de leur enfants. Elle a plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Fatou commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. A l’avenir elle voudrait diversifier ses produits et augmenter ses revenus ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en: The Deggo Group is comprised of 20 women who live in the same area. This will be their first loan, which they will to use to grow their business throughout the commune. Their president, Fatou, is a very brave woman who gained experience in the buying and selling of food and cosmetic products. She will use her amount to build her business and buy food such as rice, sugar and milk. She is a married mother whose main responsibility is to her family. She often helps her husband pay for their daily living expenses and their children's school fees. She has over five years of experience in this sector. Fatou's day starts at 8 am and finishes at 6 pm. In the future, she would like to diversify her products and increase her profits. By doing this, she will be able to better meet her family's dietary needs.

loans.use: to build her business and buy food such as rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber and other materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Badara Aliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Aliou Badara est un homme qui habite dans le même quartier ou se situe le guichet. Il est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans l’agriculture et demande ce prêt pour acheter des semences et des intrants pour la culture de l’oignon. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Aliou Badara a une expérience de plus de 12ans dans cette activité. Il commence sa journée à 7h du matin pour la terminer à 19h du soir. A l’avenir, il voudrait diversifier sa production en cultivant des choux, carotte et oignon. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son rêve principal est de développer son périmètre agricole et devenir le fournisseur potentiel en oignon et carotte dans la  commune.
texts.en: Aliou Badara lives in the same area where his stall is located. He is a married family man. After gaining experience in the agriculture sector, he is now asking for this loan in order to buy seeds and fertiliser for growing onions. He pays for his family's daily expenses and his children's school fees. Aliou Badara had over 12 years of experience in this domain. His day starts at 7 am and ends at 7 pm. In the future, he would like diversify his production by growing cabbage, carrots and onions. By doing this, he will be able to increase his profits and improve his family's living conditions. His dream is to increase the size of his plot of land and to become the commune's main onion and carrot supplier.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser for growing vegetables

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, ya que es temporada de lluvias y en su ciudad son abundantes, principalmente realizara mejoras en el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera ella podrá seguir trabajando, y podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Mejorar su vivienda y seguir sacando adelante a su familia”.
texts.en: Marisol is very grateful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they've given her, she can make improvements in her home- specifically the roof of her home. It is currently the rainy season and it is abundant in her city. This way she can continue working and fighting for the ability to realize her grand dream: "To improve her home and continue moving her family forward."

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Aram

texts.fr: Aram est une promotrice qui évolue dans l’achat et la vente de chaussures, tissus et draps. Elle est veuve et mère de famille. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des draps, chaussures, cosmétiques et tissus. Elle gère toutes les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Aram commence sa journée à 9h pour la finir à 18h. Elle voudrait renforcer son fond de roulement et grâce aux crédits de l’institution acheter une machine à coudre et booster d’avantage son activité. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Aram is a pioneer who gained retail experience by selling shoes, fabrics and sheets. She is a widowed mother. She has over 10 years of experience in this sector. She is requesting a loan in order to buy sheets, shoes, cosmetics, and fabrics for resale. She is in charge of all her family's daily living expenses and her children's school fees. Her day starts at 9 am and finishes at 6 pm. With the help of this loan, she would like to increase her working capital by purchasing a sewing machine, which will speed up her work. By doing this, she will be able to increase her profits and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheets, shoes, cosmetics, and fabrics for resale

loans.name: And Diok Group

texts.fr: Le groupement AND DIOK est composé de 8 personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. Elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Leur président s’appelle FAMBAYE, c'est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo et elle évolue dans la commercialisation des produits alimentaires comme le riz, l’huile, le savon et le lait. Elle  a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Elle demande ce crédit  pour acheter et vendre des produits alimentaires dans le marché et parfois dans les coins du quartier. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir et grâce aux crédits de l’institution, détenir le monopole de fournisseur de riz dans son quartier.
texts.en: The And Diok Group is comprised of eight women living in the same home. This will be their first loan. Their group president is called Fambaye, the woman who has her hand raised in the photo. She gained experience in the retail sector through selling consumer products such as rice, oil, soap and milk. She has over five years of experience in this sector. She is requesting a loan in order to aid her buy and sell consumer products at market and sometimes on the street corners in her local area. She helps her husband manage their family's daily expenses. Her day starts at 8 am and ends at 6 pm. In the future, with the help of this loan, she hopes to have a monopoly over rice production in the local area.

loans.use: to buy and sell consumer products such as rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Beugue Sa Bopp Group

texts.fr: Le groupement BEUGUE SA BOPP est composé de 08 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et qui ont le même ambition dans la vie. Leur président s’appelle Fatou, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Fatou évolue dans la commercialisation des légumes. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des légumes comme le choux, carotte, navet aubergine etc.. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans dans cette activité et aide son mari dans  la gestion des  dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et les frais de scolarités de ses enfants. Elle commence  à 9h pour terminer à 19h. A l’avenir elle souhaite grâce à l’aide de l’institution diversifier ses produits afin d’augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent.  Le principale projet futur de Fatou est d’ouvrir une grande boutique de produites alimentaires.
texts.en: The Beugue Sa Bopp Group is comprised of eight women living in the same local area who all share the same ambitions for life. Their group president is called Fatou, a married mother. Fatou gained experience in the retail sector through selling vegetables and cosmetic products. She will use this amount to buy vegetables like cabbage, carrot, turnip, eggplant etc. She has over 10 years of experience in this sector and helps her husband pay for their family's daily expenses and their children's school fees. Her day starts a 9 am and finishes at 7 pm. In the future, with the help of this loan, she hopes to diversify her products in order to increase her profits and save some money. Fatou's main project for the future is to open a large stall  which sells food products.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: David;s Group

texts.en:
David, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children; all are in school. He has been running this business, selling new slippers and towels. He works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be David's second loan from ID-Ghana. He used the previous loan to increase the stock of slippers and towels business. He is doing great. He has successfully repaid back his loan. He used the profit to pay school fees, buy a TV stand, and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase stock by buying quality slippers and towels, and sell to customers.
 
David will take this loan with his loan group, which has a total of three members, who will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan amount of GHS 2,600.

loans.use: to increase stock by buying quality slippers and towels to resell.

loans.name: Jennifer Corayma

texts.es:
Ella es jennifer, estudia auxiliar de enfermería en campo alto, esta en tercer semestre, ya realizo la parte teórica en la sede, esta realizando las practicas desde el mes de diciembre en un hospital, es una gran oportunidad porque puede brindar una gran ayuda y apoyo a le paciente a medida que va a prendiendo, escogió esta carrera porque es una profesión muy bonita al tratarse de ayudar a otras personas a recuperarse y sentirse mejor al momento de estar pasando por un mal estado de salud, el hospital le da la oportunidad de realizar procedimientos.
Una de las razones que la motivo a estudiar en campo alto fue el beneficio que le brindaron de pertenecer a un convenio en el cual pagaba un valor pequeño de su mensualidad, pero desafortunada mente el programa se acabo y las cuotas son un poco altas para pagarlas, porque no tiene un trabajo estable y le toca pagar lo de los buses a diario, por eso esta solicitando a kiva  que por favor le brinden su apoyo y pueda pertenecer a este programa para poder seguir estudiando y cumplir el sueño y meta que es terminar el técnico en auxiliar de enfermería y empezar el proceso para poder entrar a la policía, este técnico es una gran ayuda ya que también le enseña a sobrevivir cada día y a tener en cuenta que mucha gente tiene problemas mucho mas graves tanto de salud como familiares que por los que ella se queja, es una profesión muy bonita porque le enseña mas de la vida y le da la fuerza para salir adelante sin importar los obstáculos.
Agradece a campo alto por brindarle todo el apoyo y a kiva por poderle ayudar con la carrera.
texts.en:
This is Jennifer.  She is studying to be a nurse’s aide at Campo Alto; she’s in her third semester.  She has already finished the theoretical portion on campus, and since December has been doing her practical training in a hospital.  This is a great opportunity, because she can be a big help and support to the patients while she goes on learning.  She chose this major because it is a lovely profession to try to help others recover and feel better just when they are going through a bad time of poor health.  In the hospital they give her the opportunity to do a lot of procedures.

One of the reasons she was motivated to study at Campo Alto was the chance they gave her to have an agreement in which she paid only a small portion of her monthly fees.  Unfortunately, the program ended and the costs are a little high for her to pay, because she doesn’t have a consistent job and she has to pay the daily bus fares.  Because of this, she is asking Kiva to please give her support and allow her to belong to their program.  In this way she can keep studying and complete her dreams and goals to finish her nurse’s aide program and begin the process to enter the police force.  This program is a great help because they teach you to survive every day and keep in mind that many people have problems that are worse than those that she could complain of, whether they are health problem or family problems.  She thinks it is a lovely profession because it teaches her more about life and gives her the strength to get ahead, regardless of the hurdles.

She is grateful to Campo Alto for giving her support and to Kiva for helping her with her major.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's registration fees.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive junto a sus hijos en una casa arrendada en el sector llamado Ortuño, perteneciente a la parroquia Pastocalle del cantón Latacunga, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador con el esfuerzo de  sus padres logró terminar la primaria  para luego dedicarse a trabajar ya que por falta de recursos económicos se vio obligada a hacerlo para poder sustentar sus propios gastos , viven en  una ubicada en un sector rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi, su hogar es muy humilde pese a las grandes necesidades que han pasado son muy unidos entre cada miembro de la familia, Rosa cuida del sus hijos ya que el padre de ellos no ha sido responsable y Rosa ha sido padre y madre para ellos.
Se dedica la venta ambulante de allullas, (un producto que se elabora de forma manual con ingredientes como: harina, huevos, mantequilla entre otros son horneados en leña lo que hace que su sabor sea exquisito), cueros reventados y quesos de hoja que son alimentos típicos de la zona de Latacunga estos productos los vende en la ciudad de Riobamba ella viaja todas las semanas y regresa a su casa cuando termine la venta, este negocio lo aprendió de unas amigas y hoy en día es el sustento para su hogar.
Rosa solicita este crédito para mejoramiento de su vivienda lo cual servirá para poder terminar su casa propia e irse a vivir ahí junto a sus hijos, con esto evitará pagar arriendo. Ahora Rosa y su familia quieren agradecer de todo corazón a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 38-year-old woman.  She is a single mother and lives together with her children in a rented home in the area known as Ortuño, Pastocalle parish, Latacunga canton, Republic of Ecuador.  With her parents’ efforts, she managed to finish elementary school, but then went to work.  Due to a lack of economic resources, she needed to do so in order to cover her expenses.  They live in a rural area of Cotopaxi province.  Her home is very humble.  In spite of the huge burdens that have happened, every member of her family is very close to one another.  Rosa takes care of her children because their father hasn’t taken responsibility, and Rosa has been both father and mother to them.

She works as a mobile vendor of allullas (a product made by hand with ingredients such as: flour, eggs, and butter, among others.  They are baked over a fire, giving them an exquisite flavor.), pork rinds, and cheeses wrapped in leaves. These are traditional foods in the Latacunga region.  She sells these products in the city of Riobamba.  She travels there every week and returns home when she finishes her sales.  She learned this business from some friends, and these days it is the means of support for her household.

Rosa is asking for this loan to improve her home.  It will allow her to be able to finish her own house and go to live together with her children.  With this she can avoid paying rent.  Now Rosa and her family want, with all their hearts, to thank Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making possible this growth in Rosa’s working and personal life.

loans.use: to finish fixing her house, and in this way, to stop paying rent and provide a home to her family.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is a married Cameroonian, age 44, with three children. The oldest is 18 and in high school while the youngest is 3 and in nursery school as can be shown on the picture. 

She has been in this business for over three years, which makes her experienced, and her business is profitable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with so many potential customers. This loan will increase her turnover by 30 percent.

loans.use: to buy raw food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Yolanda Nidia

texts.es:
Yolanda ha sido caficultora desde hace 18 años y tiene tres hijos. Ella es  productora de café orgánico certificado y quiere aumentar su producción y mejorar la calidad del café a través de una inversión en nueva maquinaria. Ella quiere comprar una maquina despulpadora, un motor eléctrico y construir un secador solar tipo parabólico herramientas que le ayudaran a mejorar las actividades en su finca, lo cual le costara 4.000.000 millones de pesos. Yolanda tiene 2.000 arboles de café y su meta a largo plazo es poder aumentarla en 4.000 arboles mas, así podrá obtener más recursos económicos y apoyar a sus hijos  para que termine sus estudios.
Con este préstamo, Yolanda puede invertir en un proceso integral al largo plazo que sea independiente, saludable, y balanceado. Un préstamo con Kiva representa un futuro sostenible por su venta, su tierra, y su familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda has been a coffee grower for 18 years.  She has three children.  She grows certified organic coffee and wants to increase her production and improve the quality of her coffee by investing in new machinery.

Yolanda wants to buy a coffee pulping machine and an electric motor, and build a parabolic solar dryer.  These tools, which cost 4,000,000 pesos [COP], will help improve the tasks on her farm.  Yolanda has 2,000 coffee plants and her long-term goal is to be able to add 4,000 more so she'll earn more income and help her children finish their studies.

With this loan, Yolanda will be able to invest in a comprehensive long-term process that will be independent, healthy, and balanced.  A Kiva loan means a sustainable future for her sales, her land, and her family.

loans.use: to improve her organic coffee production

loans.name: Extreme Group

texts.en:
Milagros is the featured borrower of Extreme group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to provide their beloved families with the necessary standards of living.

Milagros is a 42-year-old married mother of four children who works as a housekeeper to provide her family with the necessary standard of living. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for her beloved children's education fees to make sure that she can provide them with the best education which will help them in their future career path.

Milagros is first from the right with the red top. As for the other group members, Marissa is the first from the left and Adlene is the lady standing at the center of the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her beloved children's education fees

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 44-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be focused and God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be milk storage facilities. 

She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more milk to sell. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be economically and socially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of 20,000 KES and 40,000 KES were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a hard-working husband who operates a farming business. He has been working this business to lift up his family out of poverty. He is now 54 years old and is aiming for a progressive business.

To make it possible, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP as additional working capital in purchasing necessary farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides. He knows that through complete application of farm inputs onto his farm land, he will be able to obtain better yields this next harvest season, which will enable him to sustain their daily needs and improve his way of living.

loans.use: to purchase necessities such as fertilizer and insecticides for his farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add stock of cereals ,milk, bread etc.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: Mahbuba is a widowed woman who lives in a house which is badly in need of repair. Her husband died some years ago. She has three children who would like to live in a house which is in good condition, but her salary is not enough to make this possible. She works in a factory. Mahbuba needs to repair the roof of her house at first, and then she needs to change the doors and windows. When it rains the roof of her house can’t withstand it. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to repair her house. In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and stability that will allow them to make progress. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy slate, doors, and windows, to repair her house

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is from Kapan town. He is married and has a one-year-old little son. Over the last three years, Karen has been providing taxi service. He is already a very skilled and qualified driver, and his clients prefer to travel with him, since he drives attentively and very carefully. 

Now, because of financial hardships that Karen is facing, he isn't able to invest money in his car and be able to renovate it. He has applied for this loan to purchase new tires for winter and also to pay for the renovation of the car. The loan will be a great support to this hardworking young man, as he will be able to continue his business and gather income for his family. 

Karen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Karen, and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the car and purchase new tires for the winter season.

loans.name: Ronny

texts.en:
Ronny is 31 years old. He runs his own mobile money transfer business. He is married and has two young children, aged six and four. Ronny is a very hard working man. He raised the working capital to start up a Zoona mobile money transfer business through street vending a year ago. Today he runs his business with confidence and is very happy that through the business he is able to provide for his family and pay his rentals. 

Ronny has big plans for his business; he plans to expand by opening another outlet. The one thing holding him back is that he faces a challenge with working capital. He accessed his first Kiva loan and used it to boost his working capital float. He also purchased a new phone, which he uses to facilitate transactions. He is grateful for the financial support from all the Kiva lenders. This has made it easier for him to satisfy his customers.
He is applying for his second Kiva loan to expand his business and buy the equipment needed to be successful. This expansion will help him to increase his revenue. He hopes to keep growing his business so that he will be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new booth to expand his mobile money transfer business, and serve more customers in need of sending or receiving money

loans.name: Warsame Shaqale

texts.en:
Warsame Shaqale is 21 years old. He Studies at Alpha University College, faculty of Information Technology. 

He needs a laptop to create IT programs, and he cannot pay the money all at one time. His good news was when he got the Kaaba-Kiva laptop loan. He approached Kaaba MFI, and then Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. 

Warsame hopes to improve his IT skills when he has the laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Danaya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les  familles monogamiques au quartier Bougoula hameau un des quartiers périphérique  de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  FATOUMATA B. fait la vente de tomates  dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est la debout au milieu sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  60 paniers de tomates. Elle vend ses articles au marché et à la maison au comptant à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are married women who, on average, are 29 years old and have three children. They live mostly in monogamous families in the Bougoula neighborhood, one of the outer areas of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. The group is on their ninth loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

In this group of women, Fatoumata B. sells tomatoes. She is standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan she plans to buy 60 baskets of tomatoes. She sells these goods at a market and from home for cash to male and female customers. 

Fatoumata B. hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA, in which a part will be used to pay back the loan and the interest and the other part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe  SABALY sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier NOUMOUSSO un des quartiers périphérique  de la ville de KADIOLO. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  NAHAWA  fait la vente du beurre de karité dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est la première position assise de la  gauche  vers la  droite sur la photo.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  500 kg de noix de karité qui seront transformés en beurre.  Elle vent ses beurres  de karités au grand marché et à la maison, en détail et  au comptant à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The 5 members of the group Sabaly are married women who are on average 36 years old, and have on average 4 children. They live in monogamous families in the Noumousso neighborhood, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the town of Kadiolo.

They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, out of concern to meet the needs of their clientele.

Madam Nahawa sells shea butter as part of this group of women. She is in the first position sitting from left to right in the photo.

With her loan she plans to buy 500 kg of shea nuts which will be transformed into butter. She sells her shea butters at the large market and from home, retail and for cash to a clientele consisting of women and men.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA of which part is used to repay the loan and its interest and the other part is saved.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts.

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es:
Jessica  joven ecuatoriana nació en la ciudad de Latacunga tiene 18 años es soltera vive en casa propia con los padres y hermanos, no tiene hijos se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, este negocio lo aprendió desde muy joven a sus padres y familiares, ya que la mayoría se dedica a esta actividad, vive un una zona rural de la ciudad, sector muy conocido por la elaboración de bloque y chatarra, las ventas que realiza son en forma ambulante dentro y fuera de la ciudad.
Con el sacrificio de sus padres pudo concluir sus estudios hasta la secundaria y desde ahí tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar ya que por falta de recursos económicos se vio obligada a hacerlo para poder sustentar sus necesidades y ser un apoyo para sus padres, su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más. Hoy está solicitando este crédito para la compra de más chatarra que va a otra ciudad en la cual podrá entregarla a mejor precio y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos.
Jessica agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Jessica, an Ecuadorian young woman, was born in the city of Latacunga.  She is eighteen years old and single.  She lives in her own home with her parents and siblings; she doesn’t have any kids.  She works buying and selling scrap metal.  She learned the business at a young age from her parents and family members, because most of them do this type of work.  She lives in a very rural part of the city, in an area well known for block-making and scrap metal.  She makes her sales as a mobile vendor inside and out of the city.

With the sacrifices of her parents, she managed to finish her studies through middle school.  Since then she has had to spend her time working because, due to a lack of economic resources, it was necessary to do so in order to take care of her needs and be a support for her parents.  Her small business been growing increasingly.
