texts.en: Razia, 32-years-old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store for two years.  She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base.  In order to avoid shortages, Razia needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand.  Razia has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.  This way she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 28-year-old married woman; she has been doing business selling crockery for many years. She offers various types of crockery such as plates, glasses, bowls etc. Her husband also assists her in selling her goods to the people of their community and in the local market. Tahira makes sufficient amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for her second loan of Rs. 30,000. In this way she would be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 37 years old and a single woman with one child. She runs a small business selling bananas, ta'amu (a root vegetable), etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Melania has requested a loan to buy a crowbar, bush knives, a spade and a chain saw. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Melania will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a crowbar, bush knives, a spade and a chain saw

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is from Yerevan. Her daughter studies at university and currently is in her second year of study. Last year, Gohar took a loan from Kiva and was able to pay for her daughter's university tuition. She was very responsible and was paying her loan on time.

Now, this hard working woman, with a good credit history behind her, requests a loan. She needs the loan to be able to pay for her daughter's second year tuition and give her an opportunity to continue her education.  Gohar will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 27-year-old hard-working housewife. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband, one daughter and one son. Her husband is an auto mechanic by trade and has been running an auto mechanics workshop for 15 years, working hard to meet the needs of his family and cover their children's school expenses.

Currently he is not able to generate any income from the workshop. as  he lacks some tools and auto parts that need to be purchased. Rabia has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of purchase for some tools and auto parts for her husband's auto workshop. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanics shop in the central bazaar. 

Rabia desires to provide quality education to all her children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to pay for tools and auto spare parts.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of four children.  She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past five years. She has two cows and one buffalo, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Robina has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. For the improvement of her business she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Robina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Maritza Isabel

texts.es: Maritza, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Su primer negocio fue de venta de comidas y hace 9 años vende mercadería en general, ropa, colas y ganchos de cabello, zapatos, sandalias, cosméticos cremas, lociones, etc. Actualmente solicita un tercer ciclo que es por 10,000 Lempiras, para comprar productos de belleza como maquillajes, cremas faciales, lociones, tratamientos y otros para vender. Su plan es mantener surtido el negocio y que crezca mediante la inversión de los prestamos.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. 

Her first business was selling food and for nine years she has been selling general merchandise such as clothing, ponytails and hairclips, shoes, sandals, cosmetic creams, lotions, etc. 

Currently she is asking for her third loan which is for 10,000 lempiras in order to buy beauty products such as makeup, facial creams, lotions, treatments and more to sell. Her plan is to keep the business stocked and to grow through loan investment.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as makeup, facial creams, lotions, treatments, and other items

loans.name: Shitawa's Group

texts.en:
Shitawa is a member of Amkeni Group in Matete District.  She is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 74 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Shitawa has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative, and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Shitawa is married and has four children. She is 35 years old, and is known as trustworthy.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group.  Shitawa has been a farmer for four years.  Shitawa described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  
	
Shitawa joined One Acre Fund in 2011, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Shitawa joined One Acre Fund so that she could get new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and send her children to school.  Because she wants to help more farmers, Shitawa has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and a Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Shitawa's life because she has more farm training. Shitawa hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school.  

Shitawa and the Amkeni Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low, and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Mokhtar

texts.en: Mokhtar is a 35-year-old married woman.  She has been in the business of selling milk for many years.  She has one calve and two cows to milk.  She sells milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is the mother of three children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day to day expenses of life. Now she requested a loan of  35,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.  She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 37-year-old hard-working housewife. She is living in Lahore, Pakistan with her husband, 3 daughters and 2 sons. Her husband is a security guard by profession but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore for the past 10 years, with the profession of security guard he also drives a rickshaw at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the rickshaw, as its engine is not able to work anymore. Farzana has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of purchasing of a new rickshaw for her husband. With the profit her husband wants to buy a taxi in future. Farzana desires to provide quality education to her all children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: To pay for a rickshaw

loans.name: Basem

texts.en: Basem is 26 years old, and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is the sole provider of the family. He is an employee, getting a low salary. He said he faces a difficult situation where his income is not enough to cover his big family needs. He has a small house and he is well-known in his surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. He intends to renovate his house. Basem is requesting a loan of YER 100,000 from (AMB) to buy construction supplies to use for renovating his house. He believes that this loan will positively improve his life. He hopes to be able to provide for his family’s needs and to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for renovating his house.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en: Hovhannes lives in Yerevan with his wife and two sons. Hovhannes’s younger son Khachatur (17 years old) studies at Armenian Medical University. He is currently in his second year of study in the dental department. Hovhannes works hard to be able to cover family's basic costs and at the same time provide for them appropriate living conditions. Because of financial difficulties that the family is currently faces, it is very difficult for Hovhannes to save money for his son's education. This is the reason Hovhannes asks for this loan. With the help of the loan, he will be able to cover Khachatur’s university tuition and the loan will be a great support for him.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Esperanza, está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre. Madres y padres responsables, originarios de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de tiempo de calidad con sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos  y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal es  Ely y tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como pantalones, vestidos, faldas, short, blusas, ropa interior, ropa de niños, camisetas, camisolas. Actividad que la desempeña de forma ambulante, con un peso de unos 20 kg donde lleva su mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de ropa nueva, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Nueva Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is made up of nine members, eight women and one man.  They're responsible parents from León, located in the western part of the country.  They describe themselves as being hardworking and responsible with a desire for personal self-improvement.  They enjoy spending their free time with their children.  Unfortunately they were unable to go to school because they lacked the financial resources and had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses. 

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, Ely's the coordinator of the communal bank.  Her job is selling new clothing: pants, dresses, skirts, shorts, blouses, underwear, children's clothing, t-shirts, and sports shirts.  She works as a street vendor and carries some 30 kilograms of merchandise to steady and occasional customers.

Ely's going to invest in working capital by buying and selling new clothing so she can earn a better income in the near future.

Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have the means to a decent job.

loans.use: to buy new clothing

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en: Yegana is 40 years old, married and the mother of a child. Her son is 14 years old and goes to seventh class of school. Yegana’s husband is a barber. Her family are İnternally Displaced Persons from the city of Fuzuli, currently living in the Fuzuli region. Yegana has been in the animal breeding business for 7 years. She buys young cattle, raising them and selling them in a local bazaar. She loves her job and wants go forward in this. Therefore she needs a loan in the amount of 2300 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan Yegana wants to buy more cattle. Yegana is very thankful to Komak company and the Kiva organization for help. In the future she wants to build a new and big stall.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old single man. He works in the auto repair industry and specializes in electrical repairs.  He has been in this business for the past thirteen years as he started working at a young age to support his family. Although he is single, he is the sole breadwinner for five members of his family. 

Mahmoud is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new engine for his car.  The car is very important for his business, as he uses it to provide maintenance services outside of his garage and transport his tools.

He hopes to expand his business and workshop in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his car

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
La  asociación comunal Santa Lucia está conformada por nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Son personas que han demostrado su gran sentido de responsabilidad, cumple con su cuotas de pagos en tiempo y forma, trabajadoras con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de oportunidades y la situación económica no pudo cursar una carrera, en la actualidad luchan día a  día para brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hijos.

 Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco es  Esperanza  tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos lácteos, leche, cuajada, queso, ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su productos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  La asociación Santa Lucia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia communal [bank] association is made up of nine members, eight women and one man, responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children under their responsibility.  They are natives of Sauce which is located in the northern part of the country.  They are persons who have demonstrated their great sense of responsibility, completing their payments on time.  They are also hard workers who desire self improvement.  Unfortnately, due to a lack of opportunities and the economic situation, they could not pursue a career.  They currently struggle day to day to provide better opportunities for their children.

Thanks to her hard work and the desire to move forward, the coordinator of the bank is Esperanza.  She makes a living selling dairy products like milk, curd, and cheese.  She devotes some 10 hours daily to her business selling her products from her home.  The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and supply her business so that in the near future she will be able to secure better income.

The Santa Lucia association is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they will have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business buying and selling dairy products like milk, curd, and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita and others items to expand her business.

loans.name: Marie Sylvie

texts.en: Marie Sylvie is taking  another loan to increase her stock. She needs this loan to buy charcoal in large quantities, to resell in smaller quantity. The last loan increased her profits by 45 percent. Her standard of living did change significantly. All her children are going to school normally, they eat three square meal per day, etc.

loans.use: buy firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nelly's Group

texts.en:
Nelly, 38 years old, lives in Jepseri B village in Vihiga in Kenya. She has 7 children (6 daughters and a son). Jepseri B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a river. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Nelly and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Nelly works as a business owner, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Nelly and other promoters in her community (including: Eviny, Josphat, Josephine, and Esther) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Nelly will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Nelly wants to be a promoter because she wants to help people in her village drink treated water. Nelly believes that the dispenser will prevent waterborne diseases and is an easy way to treat water.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Nelly’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Ebby's Group

texts.en:
Ebby is 30 years old and has 3 children (two daughters aged 13 and 18, and a son aged 8 years old). Ebby lives in Madidi village in Vihiga in Kenya. Madidi village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Ebby and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Ebby runs a small business, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Ebby and other promoters in her community (including Joy, Jackson, Samson and Beverlyne) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Ebby will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. She wants to be a promoter because she loves giving back to the community. Ebby believes that the dispenser will improve the health status of her community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Ebby’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to ensure that the community has access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary lives in a home with mud walls, sand or dirt floor, and an iron roof in Chepsahani village in Vihiga, Kenya with her family which includes 4 children. The community of Chepsahani village collects their drinking water from a protected spring because there is no piped water supply in this part of Vihiga Kenya. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, often making Chepsahani’s inhabitants sick and unable to work or attend school.

A new chlorine dispenser offers a solution to the burden of sickness caused by unsafe drinking water. The dispenser is installed at the local water source, where users turn a valve to add chlorine to their jerricans, then collect water as usual. The chlorine disinfects the water and provides residual protection from recontamination. In Chepsahani, 20 households will benefit from having access to the dispenser and safe water. Mary has volunteered to be the dispenser promoter, who is responsible for refilling the chlorine and encouraging the rest of the community to treat their water and keep themselves and their families healthy. There are four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Monica, Jengo, Violet and Aggrey.

Chepsahani village needs a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining the dispenser. Mary believes that diseases will be reduced through the program and their lives will be in less risk. The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Mary’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of water-borne diseases by providing access to safe drinking water via chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
36-year-old Susan lives in Chepterit village in Vihiga, Kenya. She is an active member of the community involved in the Women's group credit and savings group and the burial committee. Chepterit village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Susan and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Susan works as a subsistence farmer growing maize and beans, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Susan and other promoters in her community (including: Elizabeth, Jane, Ronica and Timinah) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Susan will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Susan wants to be a promoter because she believes it is her duty to assist her community for the better. She believes that the dispenser will help to prevent waterborne diseases.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Susan’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: to provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Wuilmer Group

texts.es:
Jackeline es una mujer emprendedora de 46 años de edad, originaria de la Región del Pacifico de Nicaragua, desde hace 15 años vende diversos productos en Puerto Cabezas. Cuando perdió su trabajo una amiga la motivó venir a probar suerte en Bilwi, particularmente en Sandy Bay por la dinámica comercial. Con su liquidación que obtuvo de su trabajo anterior, compró su primera mercadería. Actualmente junto con su esposo son vendedores ambulantes y venden cosméticos por catálogos, zapatos y ropa usada. A las pulperías les distribuye bolsones de chivería que compra en Managua y los vende a precios accesibles y a los establecimientos de fritangas le distribuye verduras. 

Actualmente solicita financiamiento para comprar un saco de cebolla, una paca de zapatos y ropa usada, un balde de tomate, 40 unidades de repollo. Su mayor anhelo es contar con un tramo propio, para no andar caminando y construir su propia vivienda.

Alba: Tiene una Pulpería en su casa, vende frijoles cocidos y elabora tortillas.  Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadedira para su negocio. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda.

Alicia: Desde hace tres meses comenzó su pequeño negocio donde vende huevos, gaseosas, chiverías y frijoles  cocidos.  El préstamo que solicita es para comprar granos básicos para venderlos en su pulpería. Sueña con llegar a tener una tienda más grande donde ofrezca diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a hard working 46 year old woman. She’s originally from the Pacific region of Nicaragua. For the past 15 years she’s been selling various products in Puerto Cabezas. When she lost her job, a friend persuaded her to try her luck in Bilwi, specifically in Sandy Bay, because of the commercial opportunities. With the settlement money she got from her last hob, she bought her start-up merchandise. Now, together with her husband, she travels by foot and sells cosmetics via catalogue, shoes, and used clothing. She sells dairy products that she buys in Managua to local stores at affordable prices, and she sells vegetables to fried food sellers. 

Right now she’s asking for financing to buy a bag of onions, a bale of used clothing and shoes, a bucket of tomatoes, and 40 units of cabbage. She ultimate goal is to have her own sales location so that she doesn’t have to walk and to build her own house. 

Alba: She has a store in her house. She sells cooked beans and makes tortillas. She’s asking for money to buy merchandise for her business. Her dream is to have her own house. 

Alicia: She began a small business three months ago selling eggs, sodas, dairy products, and cooked beans. She’s asking for a loan to buy basic grains to sell in her store. Her dream is to have a bigger store where she can offer a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to  buy a bag of onions, a bale of shoes and used clothing, a bucket of tomatoes, and 40 units of cabbage.

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en:
75-year-old Dina is friendly, goal-oriented, reliable and well-liked. She has 5 children (2 daughters aged 29 and 12 years; and 3 sons aged 25, 18 and 11 years). She lives in Shihanjiro B village in Vihiga, Kenya. Shihanjiro B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from a protected spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Dina and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Dina is currently enjoying her retirement from work, but has volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Dina and other promoters in her community (including Janet, Millicent, Miriam and Gideon) need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Dina will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser, and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. She wants to be a promoter because she wants to help her community drink safe water. She believes that the dispenser will be good for their health.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. The sale of carbon credits, to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint, will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Dina’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 20 años de edad vive con su hija, su madre y sus hermanos en casa propia pero no poseen luz eléctrica, ella trabaja como domestica en una casa que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde ella reside no poseen luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica que es la que muestra en la fotografia, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
The client is 20 years old. She lives with her daughter, her mother and her siblings in their own house. It does not have electricity. She works as a domestic in a house that is close to her home. She got the job to be able to pay some of the household expenses.
She is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp as the community in which she lives does not have electricity and the money she has isn't sufficient to purchase it. The lamp is a charging station that gets it's energy from solar panels which form the lamp. It is designed to serve homes in rural areas that don't have electricity. It is shown in the photograph. With this purchase she can enjoy the benefits along with her family of having their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar light.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fermina is 54 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Fermina has a general store business in the Philippines. Fermina requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock such as snack foods, soft-drinks, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Fermina has been in this business for four years. Fermina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as snack foods, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 33-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and two children in the small village of Tsalka district. He is involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. 
Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Davit was unable to study a professional career. He works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing potatoes. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. In addition, they own 2 cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. As the family has only seasonal income, Davit decided to start his own stable business and seek for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Davit's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2500 Gel for purchasing a minibus. As the minibus is purchased he will get orders to transport cargo to different destinations and increase the income of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start working in transportation.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.es: Bernardita , tiene la edad de 53 años, está casada y actualmente vive con su esposo y su madre. Ella con el crédito va comprar una novillas para meterlas en su propiedad. Ella cuentan con terrenos de repastos aptos para le explotación de este proyecto. Ella lo que quiere es producir leche y sacar queso y otros productos para luego venderlos y generar más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y minimizar el peso de las responsabilidad de su esposo con los gastos.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Bernadita is 53 years old. She is married and currently lives with her husband and mother. With this loan she is going to buy heifers to put on her property. She tells us that she has sufficient pasture land to carry out this project. She hopes to produce milk and cheese and other dairy products to later sell and generate income for the well-being of her family, and to minimize the weight of her husband's responsibility with the bills. 

This is her first loan cycle with FUDECOSUR. She has not received any bank loans before in state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with greater ease and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 48-year-old married woman, who has been working as a tailor since eight years ago.
She is a hard worker, well known in her region with a good reputation and special talent in her business. Souad works hard to support her husband in their living, to make sure that they'll have a secured financial living in the future while aging with each other.
She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary tailoring machine and tailoring needs that will help her in developing her business and replying to her customers' Christmas needs in a faster way since her current machine isn't working well anymore.
She hopes to expand and develop her business more and move it outside of her house to give both her husband and customers the privacy they deserve to have.

loans.use: To buy necessary tailoring machine and tailoring needs that will help her in developing her business and replying to her customers' Christmas needs more quickly since her current machine isn't working well anymore.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is 38. She lives in Vanadzor town with her daughter and husband. Over the last 5 years, Armenuhi has been involved in the retail business. She resells clothing and dressmaking supplies. She brings clothing from Yerevan and resells it from her house. Due to the hard work that Armenuhi is doing, she is well known among locals who prefer to purchase clothing accessories from Armenuhi.
Currently, for being able to purchase new stock of clothing, Armenuhi needs financial support. She asks this loan for being able to purchase stock of clothing and resell it to her customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will be a big help for Armenuhi, and will give her an opportunity to continue and enlarge her retail business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for reselling it to customers.

loans.name: Uracan Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo conformado por tres mujeres; se caracterizan por poseer un espíritu emprendedor y muestran entusiasmo en el trabajo que realizan. Este grupo es originario de Bilwi y están comenzando a trabajar solidariamente.

Florencia, tiene 45 años de edad, es originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi,  madre de 5 hijos, tres adultos y dos adolescentes que van a la escuela. Habita en una pequeña vivienda de madera, con sus hijos, nietos y con apoyo de su esposo desde hace tres años comenzó su pequeño negocio en el mercado de Bilwi. Vende artículos plásticos y ropa para niñas y mujeres que ella misma confecciona.  Solicita financiamiento para comprar en Managua 2 docenas de vasos plásticos y de vidrios, media docena de Panas, media docena de escoba, rastrillo, telas para confeccionar togas y birretes en esta época de promociones escolares, por lo que espera incrementar su clientela y vender sus productos a precios accesibles. 

Dionicia: Tiene una pequeña pulpería en el mercado, donde vende verduras, granos básicos y chiverías. Solicita financiamiento para comprar más productos en Managua y diversificar con utensilios de cocina. Su sueño es que su negocio vaya creciendo.

Kenia: Vende ropa usada desde 3 años en un pequeño tramo en el mercado de Bilwi. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar una paca de zapatos usados y una paca de ropa usada para vender en su negocio. Sueña con llegar a tener una tienda de ropa nueva para niños y tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three woman of an enterprising spirit and who demonstrate enthusiasm in the work they do. The group is native to Bilwi and have begun to work together. 

Florencia is 45 years old. She is native to Bilwi and has five children, three of them adults and two who attend school. She lives in a small wooden house with her children and grandchildren and with the help of her husband, she started a small business in the Bilwi market  three years ago. She sells plastic goods and clothing for women and children, which she makes herself. She is requesting this loan to buy in Managua two dozen plastic and glass vases, half a dozen pairs of corduroy pants, half a dozen brooms, rakes, clothes to make gowns and mortarboards for this graduation season. She hopes to increase her clientele and sell her products at accessible prices.

Dionicia has a small store in the market where she sells vegetables, basic grains and spices. She needs the loan to buy more products in Managua and to diversify by selling kitchen utensils. She hopes to expand her business.

Kenia is a 25 year old native of Bilwa, is married and has a son who is still a minor. She has sold used clothing for the past three years in a small section of the Bilwi market. She will use the loan to buy a bundle of used shoes and a bale of used clothing to sell in her business. She dreams of having a store to sell new clothing for children and of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as kitchen and cleaning supplies and material for clothing in Managua for her business.

loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Jaya, age 31, and her husband, Sona, age 37, with their two children come from the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. They are both uneducated but know how to sign their names. She is a homemaker and her husband is a cycle van puller. Her husband's earnings are insufficient for their family, because the cycle van which he pulls is a rented one. To earn more income for their family, they both made a plan to purchase their own cycle van but due to insufficient money they couldn’t. So Jaya decided to take out a loan and purchase a van for her husband, so that her husband can easily earn more income and doesn’t have to pay any rent. They hope this business can be profitable for them because people use a van for traveling purposes and also for carrying goods.

Jaya's dream is to make her family financially strong with earnings from the business.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for carrying people and goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, tissue, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Abdiwahab Abdoo

texts.en: Abdiwahab Abdoo is 27 years old. He studies at New Generation University College, in the faculty of Human Resource Management. He faces a major problem in his learning. His problem is the lack of a laptop to learn. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments and read lessons when given in soft copy. He cannot pay the money all at one time. He requested a loan from Kaaba MFI, and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. After university, Abdiwahab hopes to study a Masters Program in Development studies.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: İsa

texts.en: İsa is 53 years old, married, has three children and lives with his wife, son and his son's bride. Already 20 years they are Internally Displaced Persons from Füzuli city and now live in Boyuk Bahmanli village of Füzuli region. İsa's son is married and he is a taxi driver at the same village. İsa has been in the sheep-breeding business at their homestead yard for many years. He buys little lambs, raising them and sells them to a butcher to earn money. Also he periodically sells wool of sheep. In Azerbaijan, sheep meat is used more and more. Various national dishes are prepared from sheep meat, like “dolma,” “küftə,” “bozbash,” etc. Today İsa needs 2300 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). For this reason he applied to the Kiva organization's partner company, Komak, for a loan. He plans on the loan to supply for winter and wants to buy enough hay for sheep, vaccinate them, etc. Isa is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for help. In the future he wants to open a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy enough hay.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is 55 years old, married and has three children. He lives with his family in Fuzuli region and has a butcher shop.  Already for 20 years, he and his family have been IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from their native land. 

Vidadi applied to Komak company for a loan in amount of 1800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to repair the roof of his butcher shop. It should be noted that, this is his third loan. Previously, Vidadi borrowed 1200 AZN and 2000 AZN, then successfully paid them off. 

Vidadi is thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for help. In the future, he wants to increase the area of his shop.

loans.use: to repair the roof of his butcher shop

loans.name: Godja

texts.en: Godja is 25 years old, single and lives with his parents in Fuzuli region. Twenty years ago his motherland, Fuzuli city, was occupied by Armenian occupants. Today his family are Internally Displaced Persons(IDP). Godja’s mother is a housewife, his father is a seller and Godja is a taxi driver. Winter is coming and he needs a loan amount of 1100 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy a new wheel and anti-crash chain. Therefore he applied to Komak company. Godja is very thankful to Komak and Kiva organizations for help. In the future he wants to buy a bus and wants to be a bus driver. In his personal life, Godja wants to get married and have children.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel and anti-crash chain

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 30-year-old married father of two children who has been working as a barber since nineteen years ago. He is a hard worker who started working at an early age, when he was supposed to quit school during his elementary class to help in supporting his family in covering their needs.

Jihad is a hardworker who puts so much effort in developing his business to make sure that it has a good enough income to cover his increasing family's needs.  Today, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva to get the requested cash to buy necessary facial treatments and men's beauty creams to increase his business income through selling these items to his current and expected clients.  He hopes to keep on being capable of developing his business and replying to his family's needs.

loans.use: buy supplies for his barber shop

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 23 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de un año y medio. Miguel es jornalero y vendedor de cocos, de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Miguel no cuenta con agua potable en su hogar por lo que desea construir un pozo dentro de su terreno ya que por la zona donde habita el agua se encuentra a pocos metros de profundidad. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y grava para construir el pozo lo antes posible y así facilitar la obtención y el almacenamiento del vital líquido.
texts.en: Miguel is 23 and lives in very humble conditions with his partner and their 18-month-old daughter. Miguel works as a day laborer and sells coconuts so that he can earn a living and meet his household expenses. The family's home does not have running water, so Miguel wants to dig a well on his land as there is water just a few meters underground in the area where he lives. Miguel is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI [Fundación Salvadoreña de Apoyo Integral - Salvadoran Foundation for Comprehensive Development] to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to build a well as soon as possible and ensure a supply and storage of the essential fluid, water.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to build a well.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es: Willian de 27 años de edad es casado y tiene una hija de 16 meses de edad. Habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su querida familia y con mucho esfuerzo van saliendo adelante. William se dedica a la agricultura y a la vez junto a su esposa han logrado abrir una venta de tortillas y antojitos típicos. Ambos se preocupan por dar a su hija mejores condiciones de vida por lo que se esfuerzan día con día por salir adelante. Con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra la materia prima como: maíz, cal, verduras, aceite, carne, yuca, etc. Para la preparación de las deliciosas tortillas y variedad de antojitos típicos.
texts.en:
Willian is 27 years old and is married with a 16-month daughter. He lives in very basic conditions with his beloved family and they manage to get on in life with a great deal of effort. Willian works in agriculture and at the same time he and his wife have managed to open a place selling tortillas and typical snacks. They are both keen to give their daughter better living conditions and so they strive every day to make progress in life. 

In order to grow his business Willian is asking for this loan from FUSAI to spend on raw ingredients such as corn, lime powder, vegetables, oil, meat, yucca etc. for preparing the delicious tortillas and a variety of typical snacks.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, vegetables, oil, meat, yucca etc. to prepare tortillas and a variety of typical snacks.

loans.name: Oscar Guadalupe

texts.es: Oscar de 40 años de edad habita en  condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposa desde hace 8 años. Oscar trabaja como vigilante en una colonia cerca de su localidad desde hace 10 años y de esa forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy sencillas y desea hacer algunas mejoras para dar a su familia mayor seguridad. Ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina Duralita para reparar y cambiar la cubierta del techo, mandar hacer e instalar una puerta y una ventana ya que las existentes están en muy mal estado.
texts.en: Oscar is 40 years old and he and his wife have lived under very humble conditions for eight years.  Oscar works as a guard in a neighborhood near his and has done so for 10 years.  He earns a living and supports his household this way.  His living conditions are simple and he wants to make some improvements for his family and provide them better security.  He is asking for a loan through FUSAI so he can buy Duralita metal to repair and replace the roof, and have a door and window made, because the current ones are in bad shape.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en: Issa is a 48-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father to one son. Issa works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income. He has a lot of monthly obligations and his salary is not enough. so he decided to work an extra job. Issa would like to buy a small rickshaw to transfer goods for the local traders. The income he will get for this job will help him pay for the family expenses. Issa took a USD Murabaha (shariah compliant) loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods to local traders. By taking this loan, Issa and his family's living conditions will be improved. Issa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods to local traders

loans.name: Santos Del Rosario

texts.es: Santos de 33 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 11 años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es que su familia tenga buenas condiciones de vida. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos de forma ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Gracias a que es una mujer amable, honesta y responsable se ha ganado la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Con el fin de cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita aumentar sus ventas e ingresos ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mariscos como: camarones, pescado de Curvina y Robalo. Confía que con esta inversión logrará su objetivo de incrementar las ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santos, who is 33 years old, lives in her own home with her life partner and their young daughter, who is eleven years old. The most important thing to her is that her family have good living standards. She has been selling seafood as a street vendor in different areas of her town for six years. Since she is a kind, honest, and responsible woman, she has gained the trust of many customers, who prefer her more and more. 

In order to meet a higher demand, which would allow her to increase her sales and her income, she decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing larger quantities of seafood like shrimp, croaker fish, and sea bass. She is confident that this investment will allow her to achieve her goal of increasing sales and earnings, which in turn will allow her to provide her family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy seafood like shrimp, croaker fish, and sea bass.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava, potatoes, plantain, oil, etc.

loans.name: Gilmar Bladimir

texts.es: Gilmar de 42 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 16 años y 3 años de edad. Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la pesca desde hace 14 años y de esta forma es como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones de las paredes de la cocina ya que actualmente se encuentran deterioradas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir la compra de cemento y pago de mano de obra para repellar las paredes de la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en: Gilmar is 42 years old and lives in his own home together with his wife and two daughters who are 16 and 3.  He makes a living in agriculture and fishing; this is how he has provided the household expenses for the past 14 years.  Gilmar desires to improve the condition of the kitchen walls which are currently deteriorating.  Therefore he seeks this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement and labor to plaster the kitchen walls of his home.

loans.use: to purchase cement and to pay the labor to plaster the walls of the kitchen in his home.

loans.name: Serob

texts.en:
Serob lives in the village of Goravan, which is in Ararat region. He is married and has two sons. 

Serob lives with his parents in a very nice house. His family lives by the help of his and his father’s hard work.  His father is a farmer and he mainly cultivates and sells onions. Serob himself has his own business.  He has a small building of his own and he makes fast food. Since it is located in a very central part of his village many people visit his eatery during the day. As Serob says, once his eatery used to be the only place where people came to eat something and just to have a rest for several minutes, but now in this field he is not alone. There are already several eateries opened and now there exists  a kind of rivalry among them.

Serob asked for a loan in the amount of USD 800 in order to repair his eatery to make it more comfortable and more attractive for his customers.

loans.use: repair his eatery

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik once liked the deal with Kiva lenders and for the second time he wants to take a loan. He lives in the village Getahovit which is in the Tavush region. His two sons are already grown up and the elder is fulfilling his military service with the army. As Gagik used to, he is still doing cargo transfers; he has a truck that he uses to carry cargo for individual and contract orders, but farming and agriculture still brings the main part of income for his family. In his nice farm he has six cows, two calves, five piglets, twenty chickens and large nice orchard. Gagik sells very tasty cheese made of his own, milk, meat and different dairy products and also fruits from his garden. All these are results of Gagik’s and his wife’s devoted work with great hope, this time to have more profit than the previous time.
For his second loan Gagik asks a loan of 1.100.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a cow, two bulls, several piglets and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy a cow, two bulls, several piglets and a lot of animal fodder

loans.name: Eliel

texts.en:
Eliel is 50 years old.  He is married to a farmer and they have four children. With this loan, he would like to use to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer for  maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming Eliel wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 53 years old. He is married and has five children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, who all go to school. She would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a youth client from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has a child.  Haydar is the only provider for his family. 

Haydar is a barber. After previously working for a few years as an employee at a barber shop, Haydar established his own business in 2007 and has been gradually gaining much experience in this field. Now, Haydar has 2 hired employees and is well-known in his surrounding area. 

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop, install a display window and a sign for his barber shop. In the future, Haydar is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to open a bigger barber shop and attract more customers and thus provide more income for his family.

loans.use: renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Tereso De Jesus

texts.es:
Tereso, tiene la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio en esta ocasión lo hara en el cultivo de maíz, por lo que opta por otro crédito con el que comprara semilla, abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y plaguicidas, con lo que tendrá una cosecha más abundante, mejores ganancias y clientes complacidos.
Con el crédito anterior su economía mejoro, la granja de pollos aumento su producción  y les da una alimentación mucho mejor a su familia, sigue trabajando para que su negocio sea más amplio.
texts.en:
Tereso needs to invest in his corn growing business, so he has decided to apply for a new loan. He will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and fungicide. He will then have a more abundant harvest, better earnings, and satisfied clients.

With his previous loan, Tereso improved his financial circumstances and was able to offer better nutrition to his family. He is still working to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicide.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar otro crédito para surtir su negocio comprar carnes, aceite, maíz, leña, gas, con esto tendrá materia prima para preprar la comidaque ofree a asus clientes y seguir trabajando  , sus ingresos aumentaran para cubrir los gastos de hogar y cancelar las cuotas.
Con el préstamo anterior amplio su negocio, pudo cancelar puntual sus cuotas, mantuvo la fidelidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María needs to request another loan to restock her business with meats, oil, corn, firewood, and gas. With this she will have raw materials to prepare the food that she sells to her clients, and continue working. Her increased income will cover household expenses and pay off fees.

With the previous loan she expanded her business, punctually made her repayments, and maintained the loyalty of her clients.

loans.use: to buy meats, oil, corn, firewood, and gas

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yesenia, necesita comprar bebidas, carnes, embutidos, arroz, golosinas, etc., para que el inventario de su chalet esté bien surtido y también tendrá lo necesario para preparar la comida que ofrece a sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a tener un negocio más competitivo para obtener los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en: Yesenia needs a loan to buy drinks, meat, sausages, rice, sweets, etc. so that her cafe is well stocked. Then she will have the ingredients on hand to prepare meals for her clients. The last loan helped her make her business more competitive which allowed her to make the revenues needed to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy sodas, meat, sausage, rice, and candy, etc

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a student. She studies at the local university and specializes in the department of Public Management. Elina lives together with her parents (her father is in the photo), grandmother and little sister. She studies hard to be able to complete her education and become a good specialist. Her parents are perfectly managing to cover family's basic needs, but it is very difficult for them save money for Elina's education. She has applied for this loan to help. The loan will give her an opportunity to pay for university tuition and continue studies at university.
Elina hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Didma Cristina

texts.es:
Didma, es una señora viuda, que luego que su esposo falleció ella ha tenido que asumir toda la responsabilidad de su familia, actualmente vive con dos de sus hijos, comenta que desde que estaba muy joven se dedico a la crianza y destazo de ganado, es un oficio que aprendió de sus padres. En todo el tiempo que tiene de practicarla no ha tenido ningún problema que le signifique dejar de ejercerla.
Comprara ganado para criarlo y luego destazarlo, le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio, aumentar sus ventas cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, mejorar su economía, también espera cancelar muy bien el crédito.
Aspira cambiar sus condiciones familiares y tener un negocio más amplio
texts.en:
Didma is a widow who has had to take full responsibility for her family after her husband died. She currently lives with two of her children. She says that she has been engaged in breeding and cutting up cattle since she was very young, an activity she has learned from her parents; and in all the years she has been engaged in this activity she has never had problems that would lead her to stop this type of activity.
She will buy cattle to breed it and to then cut it up; this will help her consolidate her activity, increase her sales, meet her customers’ requests and improve her economic situation; she also hopes to repay the loan according to schedule.
She aims to change her family conditions and to expand her activity.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Bardiss Group

texts.en: The Bardiss group consists of four females from Hodeidah, Yemen. Bards is a 29-year-old single woman. She works hard in providing the family. She has started her job creating homemade henna items, like mixing perfumes and creams which are used by brides for their wedding. She sells it to retailers, customers and door to door. Any shortages of her product items will cause her job to stop. That is why she has applied for a loan to buy the required henna items to continue her business. All members of the group are hoping to earn a good income, which will allow them to improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the required henna items to continue her business.

loans.name: Mohamed Aden

texts.en: Mohamed Aden is a 23-year-old single man. He studies Information Technology at Alpha University College. His problem is that he has no laptop, and it’s difficult for him to have practical practices. He has been informed of Kaaba-Kiva Murabaha's youth laptop loan product.  He would like to have a laptop as loan. He requested a laptop from Kaaba and now he is waiting for the laptop.  Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan and Mohamed will pay monthly repayments. After university Mohamed hopes to work as database developer.

loans.use: buy a laptop for college

loans.name: Orvelicia

texts.es:
Orvelicia es una mujer de 36 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora y madre de 4 hijos los cuales el mayor dese encuentra en hogar a parte, los dos que le siguen estudian en secundaria en diferentes grados y el ultimo en la primaria. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo cursar con mucho sacrificio y mucho esfuerzo gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres. Su familia por muchas generaciones se ha dedicado a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de café y en su generación no es la excepción ya que en la zona donde ella habita es muy apta para cultivar y producir por su tierra y su clima agradable para el producto. Ella también se dedica a otras actividades como ser la cría de cerdos y gallinas para la venta desde hace 10 años como también tiene un pequeña pulperia buscando siempre como generar y aportar en la economía de su hogar. El terreno que ella y su esposo cultivan lo adquirió mediante una compra el cual está ubicado a 5 minutas de su casa de habitación en el cual solo ella y su esposo se involucran trasladándose a pie diariamente.
Hoy en día ella solicita ayuda para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos por medio de la compra de abono, fertilizantes y otros insumos que aseguraran y mejoraran su cultivo y producción de café.
Sus planes so poder seguir aumentando sus cultivos ya que la tierra es propicia para esta clase de producto y podría sembrar una mejor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, de esa manera poder generar ingresos para su familia y sus hijos y poder educarlos a nivel universitario.
texts.en:
Orvelicia is a 36 year old woman. She is a fighter and an entrepreneur. She has four children. The oldest stays in her house part-time, two study in different grades in secondary school and one is in primary school. Orvelicia has a degree in Primary Education which she completed with great effort and sacrifice and the support of her parents.

For many generations her family has been involved in agriculture, more specifically in growing coffee. Her generation is no exception. The area in which she lives is very suitable for coffee production as the soil and climate are perfect for this product. She has also raised pigs and chicken commercially for the past ten years as well as running a small store. She is always looking for ways to generate revenue and support the household.

The land that her and her husband work was bought by them. It is five minutes from their house so they walk back and forth daily.

Today Orvelicia is requesting a loan to protect and maintain her crops by buying fertilizer, manure and other supplies that protect and improve her crop and production of coffee. Her plans are to expand her plantings as the land will support this kind of production and plant a greater variety of product to be able to offer to her clients. In this way she can generate income for her family and educate her children through to university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Kohinur

texts.en:
Kohinur is 43 years old and a married lady. Her husband Safiyar is 51 years old. They have four children (two sons and two daughters). Kohinur's sons are associated with small business and her daughters are getting their higher education. They are from the small town of Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri. They have their own land, and her husband cultivates different seasonal vegetables in that land. In this winter season they plan to cultivate eggplant and for that Kohinur needs to purchase seeds and fertilizers so she applied for a loan. It is a profitable business for them as her husband is already associated with this work. 

Kohinur is a hardworking woman. She wants to improve her family's financial condition after earning good profit from this business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer for cultivating eggplant.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a married woman of 26 years.  She is living with her husband, Jadav, and three children in Katalbari in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district. Her husband is 35 years old and his occupation is farming. Their children are engaged in education. Malati studied up to class VII and Jadav up to class V.

Their main source of income is growing bitter-melon so they want to take proper care of their agricultural activities for growing bitter-melon. In spite of having a small plot of land, they have a keen interest to cultivate karala correctly so they applied for a loan from BJS to invest in farming as well as for more education for their children. They are now not capable of living their life smoothly and are facing many problems due to their low income.

Malati has a kacha house made of mud and straw which is not stable for them due to natural calamities (flood, tsunami, earthquake, etc.) She will be highly obliged if BJS grants this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing bitter-melon (karala).

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Bina is 26 years old. She is a hard-working woman from a remote region of Bagnan in the district Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband, Bipul, and their only son. Her husband, Bipul, is 30 years old. Bina received education up to Class VII (Grade 7) and Bipul up to  Class VI (Grade 6). They live in their small kachha house (made of mud and straw) .Their son is below school-going age.

Bina's husband is a mason by trade. He is the only earning member of the family. But it is a competitive market; his earnings are not enough to provide sustenance.

Bina decided to give financial assistance to her husband and her family by cultivating bananas in their own land. She applied for a loan from BJS. With this loan she wants to buy banana saplings and good quality fertilizers. She has chosen this business as there is a good demand for bananas in their locality and in the present market.

In the future she wants to develop her business and earn more profit. Her dreams are to provide higher education to her son and to meet the expenses of their family with the profits from her business.  Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase good quality banana saplings for cultivating bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: María de 55 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hijo y sobrino quienes son mayores de edad y le colaboran con la economía del hogar. María habita en condiciones muy humildes y trabaja muy duro para ganarse el pan de cada día y mantener la economía del hogar. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de ricas tortillas(preparación alimenticia preparada a base se masa de maíz). Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de maíz, gas propano, etc. para aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: María is 55 years old. She lives in her own house with her son and nephew who are both adults and contribute to the household expenses. María lives in very modest conditions and works hard to earn her daily bread and maintain her household. She makes tasty tortillas (a flat bread made from corn dough). This business is her main source of income and she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of corn and propane to increase her sales and her revenues.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. Geraldine is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Geraldine requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Geraldine has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling electronic mobile load. Helen is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like chicken, pork, hotdogs, etc. for her food vending business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken, pork, and hotdogs for her food vending business

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina  es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación a sus 38 años de edad es propietaria de una fotoestudio y siendo una mujer divorciada considera que ese no es un obstáculo para sacar adelante a sus hijos; un joven que estudia bachillerato a sus 15 años de edad y un menor que se encuentra estudiando su nivel primario  a nivel del tercer grado y su edad es de 9 años. El nivel académico de la señora es bachillerato, ella aprendió sobre el negocio de la fotografía en su largo tiempo, trabajando en una Foto Estudio en la ciudad. Luego ella se hizo de su propio negocio y se hizo independiente.


Reina, posee mas de 14 años de experiencia en el negocio de las fotografías; debido a que ella primero  trabajo, ese trabajo le permitió conocer a profundidad como manejar un negocio de este tipo, conocer proveedores, atención al cliente, etc. Motivada por la rentabilidad del negocio y con el apoyo de un crédito, ella logro implementar su propio negocio y convertirse en una negociante independiente. En dicho negocio la señora cuenta con el apoyo de su hermana y su hijo mayor quienes le apoyan en sus tiempos libres o cuando la demanda lo requiere.

El Crédito otorgado será utilizado para realizar una remodelación en el local, donde esta ubicado el negocio, ella manifiesta que necesita hacer algunos cambios y mejorar la presentación de su negocio y de igual manera comprar algunos materiales o equipos básicos para mejorar sus servicios de fotografías. El objetivo principal es, mejorar la vista de su negocio y así atraer a mas clientes y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, mejorando así las condiciones de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos en sus desarrollo académico y profesional.

Las metas que como familia tienen para un futuro es, apoyar a sus hijos mediante la educación y que sean unos profesionales, ademas que el negocio de fotografías sea cada día mas competitivo, rentable y este adecuadamente equipado para ofrecer los mejores servicios en lo relacionado a fotografías. Con el apoyo de Fundación Campo, espera hacer este sueño realidad.
texts.en:
Reina at 38 is a hard-working woman who desires to get ahead. She owns a photo studio. Being a divorcee does not feel like an obstacle to her in raising her children. One is 15 and is in Secondary school and the other is 9 years old and is in Grade 3. She graduated from Secondary school. She learned about the photography business in her many years working in a photo studio in the city. Then she opened her own studio to work for herself.
 
Reina has more than 14 years in the photography industry. Her work has allowed her to understand in depth how to manage a business of this type, know the suppliers, and how to pay attention to her clients. Motivated by the profitability of this business and with the help of a loan she she managed to open her own business and become a entrepreneur. She has the help of her sister and her older brother and her eldest son who help in their spare time or when there is a lot of demand. 

The loan will be used to remodel the shop. She states that there needs to be some changes and some improvements made to the shop's appearance and also buy some basic equipment and materials to improve her photographic services. The main objective is to improve the appearance of the shop to attract more clients, increase her revenues and improve the living conditions for her family. She wants to also help her children's academic and professional development. She also wants her business to become more competitive and profitable every day, and be properly equipped to offer the best photographic services to her customers. With the assistance of Fundación Campo she hopes to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to remodel her business space to improve it's appearance and buy some basic equipment and material for her photograph service.

loans.name: Rafayil

texts.en:
Rafayil is a 34-year-old man.  He has lovely family: wife and son.  His wife is a housewife and helps him in his business.  His son goes to the seventh class in school.
