Rafayil's family are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in Dovlatyarli village in the Fuzuli region. 

Rafayil has been in the animal breeding business. He buys young calves, raises them and sells them in the bazaar to earn money. Winter is coming and he wants to prepare for winter. Therefore he is requesting for a loan amount of 2100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for buy chaff, hay and straw for his cows. 

Rafayil is thankful to Komak and  Kiva organization and lenders for their help. In the future, he wants to start producing dairy products and selling them.

loans.use: to chaff, hay, straw for his cattle

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo instead.

Ola is a 20-year-old married woman from Dier Al-Balah.  She is a mother of two small sons.  Ola's hsuband works as an employee with a very low income. For the past two years, Ola's husband has been working in a barber shop that he owns. It is a good project and he has a good experience.

Ola took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to develop his barber shop by buying new tools and beauty products he often uses  in his work. This will improve her barber shop and the family income will increase

loans.use: buy barber tools and products

loans.name: Banco Mujer Forjando Sueños Y Metas Group

texts.es: Este grupo siempre ha presentado una excelente conducta de pago, han logrado aumentar sus ahorros y si alguna tiene alguna emergencia puede solicitar dinero prestado al grupo y devolverlo un mes después con intereses. Muchas han cambiado su actividad productiva ya que la zona donde viven no les permiten tener animales para engorde, a pesar de esto lograron continuar con el comercio y actualmente les va muy bien reciben buenas ganancias. Por lo que desean invertir en la compra de maquillaje, ropa y joyas de catálogos, en cerdos de engorde, ganado y abarrotes para la pulpería. Ya que sus clientes solicitan mucha mercadería.  Actualmente no están las integrantes que iniciaron el grupo pero las cinco que quedan son las correctas para continuar funcionando, son todas muy trabajadoras y con ganas de continuar en lo propio; ya que viven en una de las zonas rurales de San Jose donde no hay suficientes fuentes de empleo. Eligen Fundación Mujer ya que ninguna otra financiera puede prestarles para las actividades de ellas, además les gusta el seguimiento que se les brinda con el crédito.
texts.en:
This group has always presented an excellent conduct in terms of loan repayment, they have managed to increase their savings and if one of the members were to have an emergency, they could request money from the group and repay it a month later with interest. A lot of them have changed their activity as the area in which they live they are unable to have animals to fatten up. Despite this, they manage to continue in sales and it is currently going very well and they are making good profits. The plan to invest in the purchase of make-up, clothing and jewelry catalogs, pigs, and grocery supplies for a store.   

The members who founded the group are not currently involved, but the five who remain are the right ones to continue operating it. They are all very hardworking and with a desire to keep working in their own businesses as they live in one of the rural areas of San José where there are not enough employment opportunities.

They chose Fundación Mujer as no other financier can lend them money for their activities, in addition, they like the follow-up that they get with the loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Grettel

texts.es:
Grettel tiene 43 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto año del colegio, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos menores de edad, uno está en la escuela y el mayor en el colegio. Llegó a Fundación Mujer por referencia de una clienta Elia Ruiz, quien tiene una panadería y ha trabajado con esta institución desde el año 2004.
Grettel  está solicitando su cuarto crédito y ha tenido una excelente conducta de pago.
La clienta se dedica al comercio de ropa de hombre, mujer y niño desde hace más de 10 años, ella trabaja con su esposo quien se dedica también al comercio, su herramienta principal es el vehículo, el cual utilizan para el transporte de mercadería y el cobro.
Entre sus labores diarias esta la visita a sus clientes, recoger pedidos y atender las labores del hogar. Una de sus metas es realizarse como comerciante y poner un local en la zona céntrica de Puntarenas, cuidad de la costa pacífica de Costa Rica, donde ella reside.
El beneficio con el crédito sería enorme, ya que va a adquirir mercadería para la temporada de verano, que es una época importante para el comercio en la zona costera de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Grettel is 43 years old. She studied until her fourth year of high school. She lives with her husband and 2 young children. One is in primary school and the older is in high school. She came to Fundación Mujer, or Woman Foundation, by reference of Elia Ruiz, who has a bakery and has worked with this institution since 2004. Grettel is requesting her fourth loan and has had an excellent payment record.
The member has sold men's, women's and children's clothing for a living for more than 10 years. She works with her husband who is also in commerce. His principal tool is his vehicle, which they utilize to transport the merchandise and for collection.
Among her daily tasks is the visiting of customers, taking orders and attending to the household work. One of her goals is to become a merchandizer and have a store in the central zone of Puntarenas, a city on the Pacific coast of Costa Rica, where she lives.
The benefit of the loan would be enormous, as she will acquire merchandise for the summer season, which is an import season for commerce in the costal region of Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, men's, women's and children's clothes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 53 years old. He is a father of five children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rodi

texts.en: Rodi is a 38-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He is involved in a transport business and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children.  He also does brick laying in order to raise more money to support his family.  High cost of fuel and inadequate capital pose a challenge to his business dreams, and his desire is buy a lorry since it has high rate of return.  Rodi intends to use this loan to complete his payment of the lorry.

loans.use: buy a lorry

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. Abbas is the only provider for the family.

Abbas owns a garage where he specializes in fixing the damaged body parts of a vehicle. He has been in this field since 2009 and has gained experience through previously working as an employee for several years at a similar garage. Abbas has good experience in this field and is well-known in the neighborhood since he is the only person with such a profession in the surrounding areas.

Abbas is requesting a loan of $1,800. He will use this loan to buy a piece of specialized equipment for his work. Abbas is aiming to continue providing his family with better standards by improving the quality of his work and increasing his profits.

loans.use: buy auto repair equipment

loans.name: Amira Ahmed

texts.en: Amira Ahmed is a 28-year-old  girl. She studies Human Resource Management at Alpha University College. Her problem is that she has no laptop, and it’s difficult for her to prepare her university assignments. She has been informed of Kaaba-Kiva's laptop loans, and she would like to have a laptop as loan. She requested from Kaaba MFI a laptop as a loan and then Kaaba will provide her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments. Now she is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan and Amira will pay in monthly repayments.

loans.use: buy a laptop for college

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is 24 years old, single, and has no children. He is a youth from Iraq who lives with his family composed of 6 members, of whom 3 are employed. 

Haydar owns a small cafe where people come to relax, drink coffee and other homemade drinks. He has been in this field for more than 3 years and established his own business in 2011. Haydar has a hired employee and has gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area and is well-known in his neighborhood. 

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of USD 3,000,  which he will use to renovate his café and install a sign.  Haydar is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he can provide himself a good career and a bright future

loans.use: to renovate his café and to install signage

loans.name: Kelin Yolivet

texts.es:
Kelin es una joven de 29 años con un grado de estudio secundaria completa graduándose como enfermera auxiliar madre de 3 hijos quienes estudian en la primaria en diferentes grados de educación. Junto a su esposo quien es maestro de educación primaria se dedican a la caficultura desde muy temprana edad por ambas partes ya que sus familias son agricultoras por vocación y tradición. Desde hace tres años lo ejercen de manera propia en un terreno que fue heredado por sus padres ubicado muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando.
Los planes para el futuro es optar a una plaza en el área de salud y de esa forma poder ejercer su carrera profesionalmente. Su sueño mediante los ingresos generados por sus cultivos de café poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, lograr completar la educación de sus hijos a nivel universitario al igual que la de ella. 
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café que incluye: fertilización, recolección, limpieza y mano de obra. Con este financiamiento ella espera mejorar sus cultivos y generar mayores ingresos para seguir invirtiendo en la ampliación de su tierra y poder heredarla a sus hijos como un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en:
Kelin is 29 years old. She completed her secondary school degree as an assistant nurse. Her husband is an elementary school teacher, and she has three children in different grades of elementary school. Both she and her husband have worked growing coffee since they were very young, and both of their families have worked in agriculture both by tradition and because they enjoy it. For three years now, Kelin and her husband have grown their own coffee on a plot of land that they inherited from their parents, which is near their home and to which they can walk.

Kelin plans to apply for a position in healthcare so that she can use her degree professionally. Her dream is to use the income she earns from cultivating coffee to improve her family’s quality of life, and to give her children a university education.

Kelin is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and to maintain her coffee fields, including fertilization, harvest and cleaning as well as paying for labor. With this loan she hopes to improve her crops and her income. She would like to continue investing in her land and leave it to her children as a family inheritance.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to maintain her coffee fields, including fertilization, harvest and cleaning as well as paying for labor.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is an Iraqi youth client who is 23-years-old, single and lives with his family of 7 members, of whom 3 are employed and share the family income together.

Hasan owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008. He has built up good experience in this field and is becoming well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. 

Hasan is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a youth loan in order to buy two new refrigerators, 2 new freezers and to install a rolling shutter. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: by 2 refrigerators, 2 freezers and a rolling shutter for his store

loans.name: Herbert Ernesto

texts.es:
Herbert de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, creció junto a su abuela. Esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja como comerciante. Tienen un hijo, su edad son 7 años y asiste a la escuela. Vive con sus suegros, pero ellos no dependen de él.

Herbert tiene mucha experiencia en el negocio de comercio, ya que desde que dejo la escuela,su abuela le elaboraba tamales, para que los saliera a vender a los alrededores de su vivienda. Luego su abuela consiguió obtener un local en el mercado y Herbert ya no solo se encargaba de ayudarla a vender tamales, sino quetenia a su cargo también, vender frutas y verduras. Así fue como él, aprendió la actividad del comercio, gracias a su abuela.

 Ahora tiene ocho años de estar acompañado y su esposa es también comerciante, desde entonces trabajan junto con su esposa, pero ahora el negocio es venta de ropa para todo tipo. Ellos viven a 10 km de la playa y viajan los días viernes, sábado y domingo a comercializar la ropa de playa, llinas y flotadores, etc. Los otros días venden en la ciudad donde viven. Su horario de trabajo empieza a las 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde.

Herbert necesita del préstamo, para invertir mas en el negocio de ropa, ya que esta próxima la temporada navideña y es necesario que posea mas variedad de diseños, para ofrecer a los clientes. De esta forma, se estará contribuyendo a que Herbert pueda tener mas opciones de productos para la venta. 

El sueño principal de Herbert, es tener un terreno propio donde construir su casa, para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, la cual podrá ofrecérselas, solo si continua trabajando fuertemente como hasta hoy lo ha hecho.

 Para esto invertirá parte de las ganancias  para cancelar el préstamo, otra parte para continuar con el negocio y por ultimo ahorrar para cumplir el sueño de tener casa propia. Ademas, le dará todo el apoyo a su hijo para que estudie y se prepare academicamente.
texts.en:
Herbert is 27 years old. He studied until seventh grade and was raised by his grandmother. He lives with his partner and she works in commerce. They have a son who his 7 years old and attends school. He lives with his in-laws, but they don’t depend on him economically.

Herbert has a lot of experience in the business of commerce. Since he left school, his grandmother made tamales for him that he sold in the areas near his house. His grandmother later got a store in the market and Herbert no longer just sold tamales; rather, he was also in charge of selling fruits and vegetables. This is how he learned the business of commerce, thanks to his grandmother.

He has now been married for eight years and his wife is also in commerce. He has been working with his wife since they got together, but now the business sells clothing of all kinds. They live 10 kilometers from the beach and they go on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays to sell beach clothes, sandals, floatation devices, etc. On other days they sell where they live. Their work schedule is from 6:30 in the morning until 5:00 in the afternoon.

Herbert needs the loan to invest in the clothing business because for this next Christmas season he needs to have more variety of designs to offer customers. In this way, you will be contributing to Herbert’s ability to have more product options for sale.

Herbert’s biggest dream is to have his own land where he can build his house so he can provide his family a better quality of life, which he will be able to offer them if he continues working hard like he has always done.

He will invest part of his income to repay the loan. He will use another part to continue the business and he will also save so he can achieve his dream of having his own house. Also, he will give his son all of his support so that he can study and prepare himself academically.

loans.use: to invest more in his clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 21 años de edad vive con su esposa y su hija en casa propia pero no poseen luz eléctrica, el trabaja en una moto taxi desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside no poseen luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica que es la que muestra en la fotografia, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: The client is 21 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in their own house. It does not have electricity. He has worked driving a motorcycle taxi for several years. With what he earns he manages to pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp as the community in which he lives has no electricity.  He does not have enough money to purchase the lamp. The lamp is a charging station with the solar panels forming the lamp, as you can see in the photograph. It was designed to serve rural homes that do not have electric services. He can benefit his family with this purchase as they will have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo, hija  y su grupo familiar. Ella se dedica a la vena de variedad de productos de acuerdo a la temporada de forma ambulante. Desea invertir en la compra de productos navideños los cuales son muy demandados en la época. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de adornos navideños, arbolitos, etc. Ya que de esta forma se gana la vida y tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día prefieren más.
texts.en: Ana is 22 years old. She lives in her own home along with her husband, daughter and family. She sells a variety of goods according to the season. She sells door to door. She wants to buy Christmas products which are much in demand in this season. With her last loan she bought a variety of Christmas decorations, small trees etc. In this way she makes her living. She has done this for a long time so she has many clients who prefer her, more all the time.

loans.use: to buy a variety of Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Hermosilia

texts.en:
Hermosilia is 53 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Hermosilia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Hermosilia has been buying and selling livestock for 20 years and earns additional income from tobacco vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old and married with six children. With five of her children currently in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store.

Janet has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, soft drinks, juice, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Janet would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jeber

texts.en:
Jeber is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 37 years old. 

Jeber has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Jeber requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Jeber has been in this business for two years. Jeber would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Jeleta

texts.en:
Jeleta is 56 years old and married with nine children. In the agricultural business in the Philippines, she buys and sells livestock. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy additional goats to sell.

Jeleta has been buying and selling livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed 17 times from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and works hard to support her family. For the past three years she has bought and sold clothes in the Philippines.

Jocelyn is applying for a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell. Her ambition is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 32, is a married woman and has three children who are in school. She works hard to support her family.

Josephine has sold fish in the Philippines for the past year. She is applying for a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She is working to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy an additional box of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Jovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Munmun

texts.en:
Munmun, age 24, is a housewife. She lives with her three children and husband in their own Kachha house (straw and mud made) at Nirendrapur in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her husband Sahidul, 35 years old, is a farmer. Both of them are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their son reads in Class II (Grade 2) and their daughter is in Class I (Grade 1). The other daughter is below school-going age.
 
Her husband works on their small plot of land and grows green vegetables, which he sells in the local market to provide their family's income. Her greatest expense is food and educational expenses for their children, which she cannot cover with her husband's small income.

Munmun asked for a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes on their land. She has chosen potato cultivation since it is a very profitable business in their area and is in great demand in their locality and in the present market.

Her plan is to meet the financial needs of their family and give her children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Yama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé depuis septembre 2013.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême gauche et levant la main,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 32 ans,elle est mariée et mére d'une fille et de 03 garçons.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 12 paires de chaussures à 1500f l'une et 10 tenues de vêtements prêt à porter à 2500f la tenue.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
This group was established on September 2013. It is made up of members who live in the same village; they all work as small traders.

The person on the extreme left and raising her hand is our featured borrower.  She is 32 years old, married and mother of a girl and three boys.

With this loan she intends to buy 12 pairs of shoes costing 1,500 Francs a pair and 10 ready-to-wear clothing at 2,500 Francs per outfit.

Her goal is to increase her savings and meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear children clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Rongmala

texts.en:
Rongmala is a 30-year-old married woman. Her family consists of her husband and a small daughter. She passed Class VI (Grade 6). Her husband Sukumar, age 35, is a carpenter by profession. He has received a primary education. Their only daughter reads in Class II (Grade 2).

They live in their own small kachha house (mud and straw made) in the small village of Nirendrapur in the district of Jalpaiguri. The main source of income for the family is her husband's business, which is not going well at present. She decided to start a new business growing potatoes to help her husband.

She learned about Kiva partner BJS and applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes on their piece of land. She is very hopeful that the cultivation will be very profitable, as there is a great demand for potatoes in the local market. She is motivated to give her full effort to start a successful cultivation business. She also hopes to give her daughter a good education in a good school and to give additional financial support to her family.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva both for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna, a 23-year-old housewife, lives with her only son and husband Nimai in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their small kachha house (a house made of mud, bamboo and straw). Krishna attended school up to class V (Grade 5), but her husband completed a higher secondary education (Grade 12). Their only son is below the school-going age.

Krishna's husband Nimai, 32 years old, is a farmer.  He has been farming their small land for many years and supplements their family's income.  But the current business does not provide them with enough money to meet their family's needs.  Financially, she wants to give support to her husband and family. She wants to start her own business cultivating potatoes on their land to in the local market. She has given preference to this business since potato cultivation is a very profitable business in their area. She is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland to cultivate potatoes and produce more. She hopes that the business will provide sufficient support to run her family well and give a good education to her only son.

Her desire for the future is to be able to build her own house with the profit generated from this business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Pobitra

texts.en:
Pobitra is a 27-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and two sons in the small village of Kathalbari in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She received an education up to Class IV (Grade 4). Her husband Bimol is 27 years old. He is illiterate and can only sign his name. He is engaged in agricultural work. He grows green vegetables on their small piece of land. He learned his work from his father and he has been doing this work for many years. They live in their own Pacca house (made of concrete). Their two sons are receiving an education. They are in IV standard (Grade 4) and II standard (Grade 2), respectively.

Pobitra is a very hardworking lady and helps her husband in cultivation. The earnings are not sufficient to maintain their lifestyle, and pay the education costs for their children and the household expenses.

Pobitra heard about Kiva partner BJS and applied for a loan to start cultivating potatoes. She will use the loan to buy good quality potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes to have a great crop and sell the potatoes in the local market, as there is a great demand in the present economy.

She dreams of making adequate income to improve her family's quality of life and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Judith has been in this business for 20 years now.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.  Judith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is 37 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Iraq and is the sole provider of the family. 

Salah owns a small cafe, where people come to relax, drink coffee, and smoke the famous Arabian hubble bubble. He also provides food services for his customers. He has been in this field for more than seven years and established his own business in 2011. Salah's business grew fast, and he now has four employees. He gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area and is well-known in his neighborhood. 

Salah is requesting a loan for $1,500, which he will use to buy a freezer, a cooler and some extra chairs and tables. Salah is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so that he can provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a cooler and some extra chairs and tables

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 29-year-old single man, who has been selling cars for thirteen years. He has very good experience in this domain since he had to start working at an early age to help his parents make their living and cover their expenses.

Mohamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for his wedding expenses and to buy the necessary home furniture that he needs. This is his fourth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. All of his previous loans helped him a lot in developing his business in a well-managed way.

He hopes to keep expanding his business in the future through opening a car-selling showroom.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses and to buy the necessary home furniture that he needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, flour, sugar, milk, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Abdiallah

texts.en:
Abdiallah is a 26-year-old man. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen.  Abdiallah's business is a grocery store that he started two years ago with limited capital. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. Though he has been working hard, he can't meet his customers' requirements due to limited capital, as wholesalers require cash payment to provide him grocery supplies. 

He managed to attract more clients. He was happy about attracting new clients, but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demand is hindering his business progress and growth. So, he took out a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) in order to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business more and increase his profit.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.

loans.name: Ovidio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ovidio tiene 39 años de edad, es soltero, reside en una comunidad  del Municipio de La Másica, Departamento de Atlántida.
Ovidio se dedica a la venta de alimentos a través de una pulpería desde hace 4 años. 
El decidió establecer este negocio debido a la falta de empleo, anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo de jornalero en haciendas de ganado vacuno.
Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 17,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de maíz, fríjoles, arroz, manteca, pan, condimentos, productos de aseo y limpieza, refrescos y útiles escolares para tener al inicio de año que comienzan las clases en las escuelas.
El espera seguir creciendo en su negocio ofreciendo mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ovidio, 39, is single and lives in a community in the town of La Másica in the department of Atlántida.

Ovidio has made a living selling food in a grocery store for four years.  He decided to start this business because he didn't have a job.  Previously he worked as a day laborer on dairy farms.

Currently he has requested a loan for 17,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy corn, beans, rice, shortening, bread, condiments, toiletries, cleaning products, sodas, and school supplies to have at the beginning of of school year.

Ovidio hopes to continue growing in his business and offering a greater variety of products to satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to buy food, toiletries, cleaning products, and school supplies

loans.name: Dezi

texts.en:
Dezi is married with six children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 19 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from selling piped water.  She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages for green bananas.   She decided to join MCDT-=SACCO because she wanted to increase her capital base.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a hard-working youth client from Iraq. He is 23 years old and lives with his family of seven members, of whom three are employed and help Ali in providing the family income.

Ali is a very well-known barber. He established his business in 2006 and through practice he mastered this field. Ali now has a hired employee and is loved and respected by many, thanks to the special care that he shows for his customers.

Ali is requesting a Youth loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to install signage for his barber shop and to renovate the interior of his shop. Ali hopes that this loan will enable him to attract more customers and will improve his business in general.

loans.use: to install signage for his barber shop and to renovate the interior of his shop

loans.name: Callixte

texts.en:
Callixte is aged 52. He is a father of seven children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Ryad

texts.en: Ryad is a married, 35-years-old Iraqi client who owns a small shop for selling mobile phones and their accessories. He offers to sell mobile phones with affordable and competitive prices and he provides all the needed mobile phone accessories for his clients. He established his business in 2003. He is gradually gaining experience through his practice and he is building a good reputation in the neighborhood. Ryad is requesting a loan of $3,000 to increase his mobile phone inventory and to renovate his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his revenues, so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to increase his mobile phone inventory and to renovate his shop

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is from Yerevan. She lives together with her husband, daughter and father-in-law. Together with her husband, Anna owns a taxi service company. They manage to provide appropriate living conditions to their family. 

Unfortunately, their current financial condition doesn't allow them to pay for their daughter’s university tuition. Anna's daughter (in the photo) studies at Armenian State Economic University and currently is in her first year of studies. So, Anna has applied for this loan to be able to pay for university tuition. She will be very grateful to lenders for helping her in paying her daughter's education costs. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Kays

texts.en:
Kays is a hardworking client from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and the father of three children. He is the only provider of the family.

Kays owns a small restaurant, where he provides local and Eastern food to sell. He established his business in 2010 and has gained much experience in this field. He now has two hired employees and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Kays is requesting a loan of $2,400 USD, which he will use to renovate his restaurant. Kays is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his restaurant.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother, and has five children. She stays at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past four years, she has operated a fresh juice-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruit juice sellers. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits at wholesale for juice preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits at wholesale for juice preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  more bread for her  business.

loans.name: Nellina

texts.es: Nellina, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y amable, además de ser trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casada y tiene 4 hijas ya adultas. Habita comodamente en su casa propia compañía de  su pareja, una hija y sus nietos. La actividad que tiene Nellina es la venta de cervezas y gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores. Los productos que ofrece a sus clientes los adquiere al contando y son vendidos en su casa a sus vecinos y transeúntes quienes son sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose a este negocio y hasta el momento solo cuenta con el apoyo ocasional de su hija,  quien atiende a los clientes cuando ella esta fuera de casa. Considera a su negocio rentable por la rapidez con la que se acaban sus productos. Le agrada realizar su trabajo pues puede manejar su tiempo libre para realizar algunas actividades del hogar, además se siente feliz por los ingresos económicos que percibe a diario con los cuales puede apoyar a su pareja a pagar los gastos de su hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas y cervezas de diversas marcas para surtir su local de atención.
texts.en:
Nellina, 59, is a happy and friendly woman.  She's also very hardworking and very much wants to get ahead.  She's married and has four adult children.  She lives comfortably in her own house with her spouse, a daughter, and her grandchildren.

Nellina's job is selling beer and different brands and flavors of soda.  She acquires the products she sells to her customers in cash and sells them at home to her neighbors and passersby who are her regular customers.  She has worked in this business for more than 10 years and up to now has only had the occasional help of her daughter, who waits on customers when Nellina's not home.  

She thinks her business is profitable because of how quickly she sells her products.  She likes her job because she can organize her spare time to do some household activities.  She's also happy about the daily income she earns, with which she can help her husband pay for the household expenses.

Currently Nellina will request 2,000 soles [PEN].  She's very happy to know she'll have some financial support because she'll be certain of making progress with her business.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

She'll invest the requested amount in various brands of soda and beer to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy beverages wholesale

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Alexandra es socia del grupo de crédito Las Cuencanitas, le gusta este grupo ya que todas las socias son unidas y comparten gratos momentos en cada reunión. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza natural, arquitectónica y cultural, esta ciudad es cuna de grandes Deportistas, escritores y sobre todo de gente muy amable.

Señora Alexandra tiene 29 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 10 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es muy hábil y se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Alexandra Alexandra es una mujer que le gusta la independencia al igual que a su esposo, por eso tienen un negocio propio que es la elaboración y venta de artesanías, venden sus productos recorriendo por la ciudad, esta actividad la aprendió de su esposo le gusta mucho porque en este trabajo desarrolla sus destrezas y no depende de jefes. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en materia prima para su negocio, como obtuvo buenas ganancias pudo solventar muchos gastos de su hogar. Ella está repitiendo el crédito para comprar más materia prima para su negocio como pinturas, cerámicas, hilos, lanas, etc. para seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Alexandra is a member of the communal bank “Las Cuencanitas”. She likes it since all the members are in unity and share pleasant moments at each meeting. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is recognised for its natural, architectural, and cultural beauty. The city is home to great sportsmen, writers, and, above all, very kind people.

Alexandra is 29 years old and married. From her marriage she has a son, now 10 years of age, who is studying at a small school in the city. Her husband is a highly skilled artisan. They do not have their own house so they rent.

Alexandra is a woman who likes independence as much as her husband does; for this reason they have their own business, which is making and selling artisan products. They sell their products throughout the city. She learnt this activity from her husband and she likes it a lot because she can develop her skills and is not dependent on a boss.

She invested the previous loan in raw materials for her business, and as she obtained good profits she was able to settle many of her household expenses. She is repeating the loan in order to purchase more raw materials for her business, such as paint, ceramics, thread, and wool so the business keeps growing.

loans.use: to purchase ceramics, paint, thread, wool, and more.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 50 years old. He is married with five children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en:
Damascene is 40 years old. He would like to use Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilzer for use during maize production

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet, a single mother of three children, is a fruit vendor in the city outskirts. She started the business to get a source of income to take care of her children's needs as well as herself, being a single mother.

She now wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can ably supply the needs of her customers and also increase her income. She is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 29 años, es una mujer joven y carismática, está casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. El trabajo principal de Carmen consiste en la venta de diversos productos regionales. Dependiendo de la temporada ofrece a la venta, plátano, yuca, limones, cocona y otros alimentos de origen animal como pescado seco y carnes de animales silvestres como venado, tortugas, majas y gallinas de chacra. Tiene un puesto de ventas ubicado en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad y en el trabaja por las mañanas, mientras que por las tardes o en días lluviosos trabaja en su casa en donde tiene instalado una andamio de exhibición de productos. Realiza esta actividad hace 15 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener contacto con las personas, le da vitalidad y mucha energía estar en constante actividad física y sobre todo se siente feliz porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos para continuar solventado sus gastos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1600, por ello agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes laborales. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de plátano, naranjas y otros productos regionales para continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
29-year-old Carmen is a charismatic young woman.  She is married and has two children, with whom she lives in her parents’ house. Carmen’s main job consists of selling various regional products. Depending on the season, she sells bananas, cassava, lemons, cocona, dried fish and other animal products, and the meat from wild animals, such as deer, turtles, lowland pacas, and farm hens. She has a stall located in a very busy market in the city and she works there in the mornings, whereas in the afternoons or on rainy days she works in her house where she has set up a place to display her products.

She has done this work since she was fifteen years old. What she likes about her work is that it allows her to have contact with people, it gives her vitality and a lot of energy to constantly be doing physical activity, and above all she feels happy because she can generate her own earnings in order to continue covering her expenses. On this occasion she is requesting 1,600 PEN, and she is grateful for the opportunity you are giving her to make her business plans a reality. With the amount requested she will buy a greater quantity of bananas, oranges, and other regional products so she can continue working.

loans.use: to purchase products, such as bananas, oranges, and lemons

loans.name: Safae

texts.en:
Safae is from Iraq. He is a 23-year-old youth client who is married and has a single child. He is the only provider of his family. 

Safae owns a small restaurant and specializes in making falafel. He established his business in 2008, and now he has two hired employees. He has built a good experience in this field, and he has an excellent reputation in the surrounding area. 

Safae is requesting a sum of $2,400 USD as a youth loan to pay the annual rent of his restaurant and to install an external ceiling. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his restaurant and to install an external ceiling

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with six children, and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, a hand dryer, braids and other cosmetics. 

She generates additional income from tailoring. She works from home and sells to all kinds of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of cosmetics. She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cream relaxers, hand dryer, braids and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en: Marvin, a young man aged 31, is employed with one of the local clearing firms in Ugafode. His salary continuously did not match his needs or the needs of his dependents, so he decided to start a retail shop to get additional income. He now needs a loan to more more items to sell in his retail shop. He is a hard working and innovative young man.

loans.use: to buy retail items to sell.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 29 years old. He is married with two children. He would like to use a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers to use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase the production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Annonciathe

texts.en:
Annonciathe is 46 years old. She will use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Posiano

texts.en: Posiano   is a new borrower aged 46 years old , he is married man with 6 children, and he applied for a loan of 500,000shs, to improve on his farming business. he has a challenge of little  output from his banana plantation so he wants to use the money to buy mulches like grass ,cow dung  to add manure  in his banana plantation, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase on his output. In the photograph is the client(left), his wife(centre) and the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy mulches for his banana plantation

loans.name: Donacien

texts.en:
Donacien is 34 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to use Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his maize yield. With profits from his farm he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use during maize production.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is single. She stays at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past two years, she has operated a fruit-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruit sellers. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for juice preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits for juice preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, meat, rice, pepper, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank, a repeat borrower aged 50 years, is a resident of Nyongozi in Ntungamo district. He is a married with eight children, and he applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX to improve his farming business. He is pineapple grower and wants to buy more grass to mulch his pineapple garden and hire more laborers. He has approached Ugafode for a loan to improve on his well being and to pay the school fees of his two children who are in school. In the photograph is Frank (centre), his wife and the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: to buy grass for mulching.

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is 48 years old. He would like to use his Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for use during maize production, he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his yield. With profits from his farm he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Doncilla

texts.en:
Doncilla is 64 years old. She is married with two children. She would like to use this Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for use during maize production, she needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her farm's yield. With profits from her farm she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is 28 years old and illiterate. She can only sign her name. Now she is married and they have four children together. Her husband Sashimohon is 48 years old. He is also illiterate, but can sign his name. Two of their children are in school. The youngest child is in class V (Grade 5) and the other is in class VI (Grade 6).  The other two sons are car drivers by profession.  They live in their own small kachha house (a house made of bamboo, mud and straw), in the village of Alta in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Sashimohon, Nilima's husband, is engaged in agriculture. He has been cultivating vegetables like beans, potatoes, onions etc. on his inherited land for the last five years. Though Nilima is a housewife,  she helps her husband in cultivation, in addition to managing all the household work. Yet they are unable to give sustenance to such a large family.

So they decided to shift to another business to increase their earnings. She wanted to contribute to the family with her own business, so she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase seeds of green chilies to start cultivation.  It is a profitable business and is in great demand in the present market.

Nilima's goal is to improve her income so that she can help her family financially, give better education to their children and expand her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase green chili seeds

loans.name: Saverina

texts.en:
Saverina is 51 years old. She will use her Kiva loan to buy fertilizer to use during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: To buy more fertilizers

texts.en:

He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is age 37. She is a mother of four children. She would like to use her Kiva loan to buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With the profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to use during maize production.

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Jamuna is a 38-year-old housewife raising two children with her husband Balaram. Jamuna attended school up to class VII (Grade 7), whereas her husband is illiterate and can only sign his name.  He is engaged in agricultural activities.  One of her children is receiving an education and reads in class VIII (Grade 8). The other child is working with his father on the agricultural land.  They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made) in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Jamuna, her husband and their son work hard on their agricultural land where they grow different vegetables in different seasons.  Those vegetables are sold in the local market. But their income is too low to maintain a family of four, when the prices of essential commodities are increasing day by day.  She needs to expand her existing business to give additional support to her family.

She applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to start potato cultivation.  With the loan, she wants to buy good quality potato seeds and fertilizers.  These will help her to achieve the goal that she and her husband set and they will be able to sell their harvest at a good price in the local market. 

Jamuna will use the profits from sales to improve her business, support her family and pay for her child's education.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more door locks, hinges, door catchers, etc to resell.

loans.name: Esther De Petit-Ance Group

texts.fr:
Jhon est le coordinateur de son groupe Esther de Petit-Ance. Il  n'est pas  marie. Il  habite dans la région nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l’eau portable est très limitée. Il dirige son commerce d'articles divers  pendants les 12 dernières s années

Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Il était  un professeur. Il  espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Il va acheter des chaussures, des vêtements et des cosmétiques. 


Des autres membres de Esther de Petit-Ance besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce tel-que ventes produits alimenteurs, boissons gazeuses, chaussures, vetement, etc. 

Jhon déclare que son défi principal est de devenir un  grand commerçant  dans le département du nord. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un grand commerce qui lui facilitera  à construire une  grande maison avec l’aide  d’Esperanza Int.
texts.en: John is the coordinator of the Esther group of Petit-Ance. He is single. He lives in an area where electricity is scarce and the supply of drinkable water is very limited.  He has been working as a vendor selling miscellaneous items for 12 years. Previously, he worked as  a teacher. He hopes that this loan will help him grow his business. He will stock up on shoes, clothing and cosmetics. Other members of his group need a loan to buy various merchandise for sale, such as food items, sodas, shoes, clothing etc. John states that his main challenge is to become a major vendor in the North province . He says that his main  goal is to have a large business, which will enable him to build a large house, with the help of Esperanza Int.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products (shoes, clothing, etc)

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar is 42 years old and he lives in the village of Debet in the Lori region. Mkhitar has three children, two daughters and a son. His son is in the army, his elder daughter is a student and at the same time she works, and his smallest daughter is still school-aged.

Mkhitar works at a stone workshop as a smoother and he also, together with his wife, is engaged in farming. There was a time when their farm was richer and bigger and Mkhitar did all the work with his parents, but suddenly his parents had some health problems and in order to pay for their medicine and treatments, Mkhitar had to sell some part of their farm cattle. As he says, fortunately all those difficulties are in the past and his parents are healthy.

Today he is doing his best to make his farm richer.  On his farm he has cows, calves, a bull and chickens. The barn for all of it he has built on his own. He manages to sell a lot of milk, meat and eggs at the wholesaler in their city and this income is a great support for his large family.

Mkhitar asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams in order to buy several piglets and a lot of animal fodder since he wants to make it as great and as rich as it used to be before.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and a lot of animal fodder

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is a 45-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, daughter, son, and daughter-in-law. Her daughter is a sales lady in a store and her son works as an artisan in a workshop. Their salaries, however, are not enough to meet the basic needs of their families. 

In order to do her bit to help the welfare of the family, Ketevan decided to open a general store. She has just opened it with her funds, sells various kind of food and home products and needs money for further development. 

Ketevan couldn't receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product between Kiva and Credo. 

She requested a loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a stock of needed products. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Regards with the Start Up program, Ketevan will be able to expand her business and increase the productivity.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of food and home products to sell

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 31 years old, married, and lives in the Zestafoni district. He has a wife and little children. Giorgi's  wife is a housekeeper and takes care of the babies. Giorgi works in a furniture factory as a worker. He earns about 500 GEL monthly, but this income is hardly enough to meet the basic needs of the family. GIorgi decided to start his own business. He requested 1200 USD to open his own factory in Zestafoni. He is an experienced worker and will easily complete the work himself. 

A startup program that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural applicants to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan. This loan will be a great support for the family. Giorgi is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to open a furniture factory.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is from the village of Abedati. She is 61-years-old and widowed with a grown son who lives with her, along with his wife and two children.
The family has only seasonal income from agricultural activities.  They have a garden where nut trees are grown and sell the harvested products locally. Darejan and her family members live in poverty and it’s often difficult for them to cover feeding costs, that is the reason why Darejan decided to purchase a milk cow and start a dairy business. Darejan will produce cheese for selling as well as family consumption. This loan will be a great support for Darejan’s family, as it will generate income. Darejan hopes for your support and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and make cheese for selling

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Valens is 35 years old. He is the father of three children aged between five and twelve years old. He would like to use the Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for use during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.



The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for use during maize production.

loans.name: Marjona

texts.ru:
Марчона продолжает свой торговый бизнес. В прошлом году она брала кредит для закупки тканей, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Она очень благодарна за финансовую помощь. Марчона не только предприимчивая, но и энергичная и общительная женщина. Она к каждому клиенту делает правильный подход, что помогает ей увеличивать количество продаж. В данный момент Марчона нуждается в повторном кредите. Теперь на сумму кредита она хочет закупить сезонные ткани и зимние теплые одеяла. 
Марчона будет счастлива за Вашу очередную поддержку.
texts.en: Marjona is continuing with her retail business. Last year she took out a loan to purchase fabrics and increase sales. She is very grateful for the financial assistance. Marjona is not only adventurous, but also an energetic and sociable woman. She takes the right approach with each client, which helps her to make sales. Now she needs a second loan to buy seasonal fabrics and winter blankets. Marjona will be happy to have your support again.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fabrics and winter blankets

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Madame Amévi âgée de 38ans est couturière de profession. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert son atelier en 2009 à domicile dans lequel elle répond aux besoins des clients. En plus de son activité, elle revend des pagnes et des articles de mercerie. Afin d'augmenter son stock, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère devenir grossiste. Elle a un enfant de 06ans scolarisé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amévi, age 38, is a seamstress by trade. After completing her training, she opened her workshop at her home in 2009. There, she works to satisfy her clients' needs. In addition, she sells "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and notions.

Eager to bolster her stock, she's seeking a third loan in order to buy more supplies. She hopes to become a wholesaler. She has one six-year-old child who goes to school.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and notions

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont mariées majoritairement  dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Moussokorobougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de savon, de charbon de bois,  de céréales, et du bois de chauffe. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle du prêt solidaire. Madame Tata  (1ère  femme assise à gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de savon dans le village de Moussokorobougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter un sac de savon (N’gabacourouni) chez les fabricants à Ségou pour  la satisfaction du besoin de sa clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  au marché du village et à la maison à une clientèle mixe. Madame Tata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 5.000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des petits  besoins des enfants .
texts.en:
The five women of the Benkadi Group are married, living mostly in monogamous households. They have an average age of 38 years and an average of two children. They all live in the village of Moussokorobougou in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of vicinity, kinship and their businesses in the village. They are merchants of soap, charcoal, grain, and firewood. With the goal of increasing their financial capacity, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their first group loan cycle.

Tata (shown in the photo seated on the far left) is a soap merchant in the village of Moussokorobougou. She intends to use her loan to buy a sack of soap (N'gabacourouni) from manufacturers in Ségou to satisfy the needs of her customers. She sells her merchandise at the village market and from her home to a mixed clientele. Tata hopes to earn an average monthly income of 5,000 Francs CFA with the help of this loan, which she will use to pay for her children's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase soap (N’gabacourouni).

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Marta siempre le ha gustado el comercio, hace tres años inicio su propio negocio de venta de mercadería vende ropa de segunda como camisas, pantalones, ropa de niño, ropa interior, blusas, faldas y también zapatos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para surtir de ropa nueva y usada para damas, caballeros y niños, con el fin de tener inventario y aprovechar esta temporada. Su plan es seguir con el negocio para obtener ganancias y ayudar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Marta is 44 years old, married with three children and lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Marta has always liked business so three years ago she set up her own store selling second hand clothes such as jumpers, pants, children's clothing, underwear, shirts, skirts, and shoes as well. 

Marta has requested a loan of 20,000 lempiras to stock up on new and used clothing for women, men and children, with the goal of creating an inventory and taking advantage of the Christmas season. Her plan is to continue running her business to gain an income and help her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy and sell new and used clothing for women, men and children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials, equipment and diverse supplies to improve her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 49 años, es una mujer buena y muy trabajadora, es madre soltera de 4 hijos pero actualmente solo vive en su casa propia junto a su última hija de 16 años ya que los demás son independientes, sin embargo le brindan siempre el apoyo necesario para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, aceites, harinas, entre otros. Tiene una pequeña bodega que ha establecido en su casa y desde ahí atiende todos los días desde muy temprano. Todo lo que ofrece al público lo renueva a diario comprando en el mercado de la ciudad al por mayor, selecciona los productos de las mejores marcas y las verduras mas frescas y saludables. Trabaja sola la mayor parte del tiempo, pero ocasionalmente su hija la ayuda cuando ella tiene que realizar algunas diligencias fuera de casa. Lleva en esta actividad 1 año y le agrada la comodidad y la tranquilidad con la que puede generar sus ingresos económicos en su casa propia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3500, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará mas productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, fideos, verduras y otros.
texts.en:
Rosa, 49, is a kind, hard-working, single mother of four children.  She lives in her own home with her youngest daughter who is 16 years old and the other children live independently.  But they always give the necessary support to help cover household expenses.  Rosa sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, oils, flours, etc.  She has a small store set up at home and opens early every morning.  She replaces everything she sells daily by going to the wholesale market in the city to select the best products and freshest and healthiest vegetables.  She works only part time and receives the help of her daughter when she has to run errands.

Rosa has been in business for a year and she enjoys the ease and tranquility with which she is able to generate an income for her household.  On this occasion, she is requesting 3,500 PEN and is excited knowing that there are people who will help her economically so she can continue with her work.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and will use the loan to buy more staple goods such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, noodles, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Melvin Jose

texts.es: Melvin José mayor de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libres le gusta de disfrutar con su familia la música, ir al cine, al parque, por falta de recursos económicos en su hogar el no pudo terminar sus estudios algo que le gustaría retomar nuevamente y ser un profesional, el día a día lucha para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es propietario de una pulpería donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, fósforos, detergentes, huevos, golosinas, papel higiénicos, productos congelados como: pollo, carne, embutidos entre otros mas, negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano cerrando tarde ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes. El objetivo de este crédito es para  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de consumo del hogar.
texts.en:
Melvin Jose is an adult who is married with two young children who he still takes care of. He comes from the town of Chinandega, located in the west of the city. He is known as a hardworking and responsible man who works towards self improvement. In his free time he likes to enjoy music with his family, go to the movies and to the park. Because of a lack of money growing up he was not able to complete his studies, which is something that he would like to take up again and become a professional. Day after day he strives to give his children a better future.
